</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:65.2pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span lang=SV
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Euler
Circuit</span></b><span lang=SV><br>
</span><b><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 2 seconds</span><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>An
Euler circuit is a graph traversal starting and ending at the same vertex and
using every edge exactly once. Finding an Euler circuit in an undirected or
directed graph is a fairly easy task, but what about graphs where some of the
edges are directed and some undirected? An undirected edge can only be traveled
in one direction. However, sometimes any choice of direction for the undirected
edges may not yield an Euler circuit.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Given
such a graph, determine whether an Euler circuit exists. If so, output such a
circuit in the format specified below. You can assume that the underlying
undirected graph is connected.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>The first line in the input
contains the number of test cases, at most </span><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>20</span><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>.
Each test case starts with a line containing two numbers, </span><i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>V</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>
and </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>E</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>:
the number of vertices </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(1 &lt;= <i>V</i> &lt;= 100)</span><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> and
edges </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(1
&lt;= <i>E</i> &lt;= 500)</span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> in the graph. The vertices
are numbered from </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>1</span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> to </span><i><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>V</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>.
Then follows </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>E</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>
lines specifying the edges. Each such line will be in the format </span><i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>a</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'> <i>b</i> <i>type</i></span><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>
where </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>a</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>
and </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>b</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>
are two integers specifying the endpoints of the edge. <i>type</i> will either
be the character </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>'U'</span><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>,
if the edge is undirected, or </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman"'>'D'</span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>, if the edge is directed. In
the latter case, the edge starts at </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>a</span></i><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> and
ends at </span><i><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>b</span></i><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>.
<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h1 style='text-align:justify'><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-font-kerning:0pt;font-weight:normal'>If an
Euler circuit exist, output an order in which the vertices can be traversed on
a single line. The vertex numbers should be delimited with a single space, and
the start and end vertex should be included both at the beginning and the end
of the sequence. Since most graphs have multiple solutions, any valid solution
will be accepted. If no solution exist, output the line &quot;No euler circuit
exist&quot;. Output a blank line between each test case. <o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<h1><span lang=SV>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                               </span>Output for Sample Input</span><span
lang=SV style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=322 valign=top style='width:3.35in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>6 8<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=SV>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoCaption><span lang=SV>Problem setter: Jimmy Mårdell, Member of
Elite Problemsetters' Panel</span><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem E - Series of Pi</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>

<style>
<!--

	{mso-gram-e:yes;}

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1032"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:LatentStyles DefLockedState="false" LatentStyleCount="156">  </w:LatentStyles>
</xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Series of Pi</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 3 seconds</span><br>
<span style='color:black'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>We all know the importance of pi
or &#960; in different fields of mathematics. Pi is a constant defined as the ratio
of the circumference and diameter of the same circle. Mathematicians have
always remained interested in finding the value of pi as accurately as they
can. For this purpose many series of pi has been invented. The proof or
derivation methods of some of these series are not at all difficult. For
example from the relation ship <span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span><span
style='position:relative;top:16pt'><span style='mso-text-raise:-16.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:150pt;
 height:38.25pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=200 height=51
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></span></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1158130229">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, we can derive the formula:<o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='position:relative;top:12pt'><span style='mso-text-raise:-12.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:161.25pt;height:30.75pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=215 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1158130231">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></span><o:p></o:p></p>

</span>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The problem with this formula is
that it converges very slowly. For example to find the value of pi correctly up
to five digits after the decimal point you have to add the first <b>130658</b>
term of the series above, which is not an healthy option at all. Also due to
the precision limitation of floating-point numbers, a series whose terms change
sign alternately succumbs to precision error severely. A better series can be
developed from the relationship <span style='position:relative;top:12pt'><span
style='mso-text-raise:-12.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1027"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:74.25pt;height:31.5pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=99 height=42
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></span></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1158130232">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. First few terms of the series will be something like, <span
style='position:relative;top:12pt'><span style='mso-text-raise:-12.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1028" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:192.75pt;height:30.75pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=257 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./e_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1028"><![endif]></span></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1028"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1158130233">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. This series converges very fast. For example to find the
value of pi correctly up to five digits after the decimal point you have to add
only first <b>7<sup>th</sup></b> term of this series. In practical field it is
impossible to sum a series up to infinite terms so generally a series is summed
until the term to be added goes below a certain value. This certain value can
be called the threshold value. Given the threshold value your job is to find
out how many terms of the second series you need to add before the term reaches
below the threshold value. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoCaption><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains less than
<b>1000</b> lines of input. Each line contains an integer <b>n</b> <b>(1&lt;=n&lt;=600000)</b>.
Input is terminated by a case where the value of <b>n</b> is negative. This
line should not be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h2><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input you should
produce one line of output. This line contains an integer which indicates how
many terms are added before a term reaches below the value <b>10<sup>-n</sup></b>.
</p>

<p class=MsoHeader>&nbsp;</p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                            </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
  ZH-CN'>1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
  ZH-CN'>5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
  ZH-CN'>100000<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
  ZH-CN'>-1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>7<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>166084<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>

<title>Problem F - The Difference Engine</title>

<style>
<!--
 /* Font Definitions */
 @font-face
	{font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	panose-1:2 11 6 4 2 2 2 2 2 4;
	mso-font-alt:Arial;
	mso-font-charset:0;
	mso-generic-font-family:roman;
	mso-font-format:other;
	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:3 0 0 0 1 0;}
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-parent:" ;

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	mso-outline-level:3;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}
p.MsoCaption, li.MsoCaption, div.MsoCaption
	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;

	font-family:Arial;
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}
p.MsoBodyText, li.MsoBodyText, div.MsoBodyText
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	text-align:justify;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;}
p.MsoBodyText2, li.MsoBodyText2, div.MsoBodyText2
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	text-align:justify;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-layout-grid-align:none;
	text-autospace:none;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;
	mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;}
p
	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
pre
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}
span.SpellE
	{mso-style-name:" ;
	mso-spl-e:yes;}
span.GramE
	{mso-style-name:" ;
	mso-gram-e:yes;}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;

	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}

	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="2050"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem F</span></b><br>
<span class=GramE><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-font-kerning:18.0pt'>The</span></b></span><b><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-font-kerning:
18.0pt'> Difference Engine</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 3 seconds</span><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>A good way to transmit information over an unreliable connection is to
use redundancy to eliminate the damage caused by small errors.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>For instance, a checksum on data can be used
to reliably determine if a mistake exists anywhere in the data.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>And if one byte (anywhere in the data) is
missing, the checksum can be used to reconstruct the value of that byte.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>We will examine a generalized redundancy
approach that allows us to reconstruct a message from which some information
has been lost.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Let p be a prime.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Suppose we have
a sequence of p &quot;chunks&quot;, a1, a2<span class=GramE>, ...,</span> <span
class=SpellE>ap</span>, each with a value between 0 and p-1 inclusive.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>We can construct a &quot;difference sequence,&quot;
b1, b2<span class=GramE>, ...,</span> <span class=SpellE>bp</span>, which has
the same format, and contains the differences between successive elements of
a.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(Modular arithmetic is used to<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>keep</span></span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> the values between 0 and
p-1)<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>So b1 == a2 - a1 (mod p); b2 == a3
- a2 (mod p); and so on, wrapping around to give <span class=SpellE>bp</span>
== a1 - <span class=SpellE>ap</span> (mod p).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>We can take the difference sequence of this difference sequence to get a
&quot;2<sup>nd</sup> difference sequence&quot;.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>In general, let the &quot;nth difference sequence&quot; be the result of
applying this operation to a sequence n times.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Not every sequence can be an &quot;nth difference sequence&quot;, so such
a sequence is redundant in a very useful way.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>If somebody tells you they have a message (a sequence of this form) that
IS an nth difference sequence, and sends it to you, you can reconstruct their
message even if up to n &quot;chunks&quot; are lost along the way.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is straightforward to encode useful
information this way: you can write p-n &quot;chunks&quot; of information, then
add n &quot;chunks&quot; to make the sequence an nth difference sequence (of
some unimportant initial sequence).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Write a program to
reconstruct messages of this form.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There will be up to 100 cases,
each consisting of two lines.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The first
line contains p, a prime number less than 100, and n, a positive integer.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The second line contains p integers from 0 to
p-1, containing the message; however, up to n of them may be missing, and will
be replaced by question marks.<o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input is terminated by a line
containing two zeros.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each case, output one line
containing the reconstructed message, which will be an &quot;nth difference
sequence&quot;.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If this is impossible,
output &quot;Invalid message!<span class=GramE>&quot;.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                           </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=295 valign=top style='width:221.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>5 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 3 <span class=GramE>4 ?</span> 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>5 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 3 4 2 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span></span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=321 valign=top style='width:240.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>1 3 4 <span class=SpellE>4</span> 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>Invalid message!<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoCaption>Problem setter: Derek <span class=SpellE>Kisman</span>,
EPS</p>

</div>

</body>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem G</span></b><b><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN;font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Riemann vs Mertens<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>One of the biggest, most mathematicians
would call it THE biggest, unsolved problems in mathematics is the proof of the
Riemann Hypothesis: &quot;All non-trivial zeros of the zeta function have real
part one-half&quot;. Now your task is simple: For any natural number N, give
the Nth zero... nah, just kidding! That would be a much too complex problem for
an online contest. We'll leave Riemann and the zeta function and concern
ourselves with the closely related, but much easier to calcultate Mertens's
function. For those interested in the subject I can heartly recommend
Derbyshire's book (see the epilogue).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Every positive natural number greater than
1, can be uniquely decomposed into it's prime factors. Some numbers have only
one factor, namely the number itself, like 2, 11 and 71, and are caled prime
numbers. Others have more than one factor, like 4 (2x2), 15 (3x5) and 144
(2x2x2x2x3x3), and are called composite numbers. If a number contains all it's
prime factors only once, it is called square free. All prime numbers are square
free. Some composite numbers are square free, like 21 (3x7) and 187 (11x17),
others are not, like 9 (3x3) and 98 (2x7x7).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Let's define the Mobius function mu(N), for
all positive natural numbers N:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>mu(1)=1, by definition; <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>if N is not square free, mu(N)=0; <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>if N is square free and contains an even number of
     prime factors, mu(N)=1; <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>if N is square free and contains an odd number of prime
     factors, mu(N)=-1. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Now we can define Mertens's function M(N)
as the sum of all mu() for 1 up to and including N:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>M(N) = mu(1) + mu(2) + ... + mu(N). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>The first 20 values for both functions are
in this table:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div align=center>

<table border=1 cellpadding=0 style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;mso-padding-alt:
 0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=right style='text-align:right'><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
  color:windowtext'>N <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
  color:windowtext'>factors <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
  color:windowtext'>mu(N) <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
  color:windowtext'>M(N)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>We want you to calculate mu(N) and M(N) for
some values of N.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4>Input<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Up to 1000 numbers between 1 and
1000000 (one million), both included, each on a line by itself. The numbers are
in random order and can appear more than once. Input is terminated by a line,
which contains a single zero. This line should not be processed.<span
style='color:windowtext;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4>&nbsp;</h4>

<h4>Output</h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'>For
each number in the input print that number, the value of mu() for that number
and the value of M() for that number, all three on one line, right justified in
fields of width 8. The input order must be preserved.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                             </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter: </span></b><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Joachim
Wulff (aka Little Joey)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Special Thanks: Shahriar
Manzoor, EPS</span></b><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:Arial'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2>EPILOGUE (Not required to solve the problem above)</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The zeta function can be defined as the infinte
sum:</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>zeta(s) = 1 + 2^(-s) + 3^(-s) + 4^(-s) + etc.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>s can be any complex number.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The zeta function has many zeros (values of s for
which zeta(s)=0). For some of them, the non-trivial ones, Riemann in 1859
conjectured that the real part of s should always be exactly one-half. The
imaginary part can have any value. Many zeros have been found so far, all with
real part one-half, but no one was ever able to prove (or disprove) the
conjecture. This now famous Riemann Hypothesis has many corollaries in all
fields of mathematics (and beyond); many theorems are based on the fact that
the hypothesis is true, so whoever disproves it (one counter example is
enough), would make a ruin of modern mathematics!</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>One way to prove the hypothesis, would be to
prove that the Mertens's function is bounded by the square root of it's
argument: M(N) = O(sqrt(N)), where O stands for the big-oh notation, which means
that for big enough N, the absolute value of M(N) will never exceed sqrt(N).
This is never proved, but if it's true, the Riemann Hypothesis is true (don't
ask me why).</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>This, and much more, can be found in the excelent
book &quot;Prime Obsession&quot; by John Derbyshire, a mathematical,
biographical and historical account of the Riemann Hypothesis. Very readable,
also for mathematical laymen like myself.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>String to Palindrome<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>In this
problem you are asked to convert a string into a palindrome with minimum number
of operations. The operations are described below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Here youd
have the ultimate freedom. You are allowed to:</p>

<ul style='margin-top:0in' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in left 143.25pt'>Add any character at any position</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in left 143.25pt'>Remove any character from any position</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in left 143.25pt'>Replace any character at any position
     with another character</li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Every
operation you do on the string would count for a unit cost. Youd have to keep
that as low as possible.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For example,
to convert abccda you would need at least two operations if we allowed you
only to add&nbsp;characters. But when you have the option to replace any
character you can do it with only one operation. We hope youd be able to use
this feature to your advantage.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h4 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>The input file contains several test cases. The first line
of the input gives you the number of test cases, </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T (1&#8804;T&#8804;10)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>. Then </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> test cases will follow, each in one
line. The input for each test case consists of a string containing lower case
letters only. You can safely assume that the length of this string will not
exceed </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1000</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> characters.<o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>For each set of input print the test case number first. Then print the minimum
number of characters needed to turn the given string into a palindrome.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>tanbirahmed<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>shahriarmanzoor<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>monirulhasan<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span

  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>sadrulhabibchowdhury<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>mohammadsajjadhossain<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=297 valign=top style='width:222.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  1: 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:windowtext'>Problem setter: Monirul Hasan, EPS<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Not the Best</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 1 second</span><b><span style='font-size:28.0pt;font-family:
Arial'> </span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'><i>Abul</i> is
not the best student in his class; neither is he the best player in his team.
Not that he is bad; he is really good, but unfortunately not the best. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>Last semester
our not quite the best <i>Abul</i> took a course on algorithms. In one of the
assignments he was required to find the shortest path from a given vertex <b>x</b>
to another vertex <b>y</b> in a weighted directed graph. As you have probably
already guessed, he rarely managed to find the shortest path; instead he always
ended up finding the <b>k<sup>th</sup> (2 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;
mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:
symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span> k </b><b><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span> 10)</b>
shortest path from <b>x</b> to <b>y</b>. If he was fortunate enough and the
shortest <b>k</b> paths from <b>x</b> to <b>y</b> had the same length, he was
given credit for his solution. </p>


<center><img width=193 height=207 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10740.gif" ></center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>For example, for
the graph above, <i>Abul</i> was asked to find the shortest path from vertex <b>5</b>
to vertex <b>2</b>. The shortest <b>7</b> paths from vertex <b>5</b> to vertex <b>2</b>
are listed below in non-decreasing order of length. For this graph <i>Abul</i>
was able to find the <b>5<sup>th</sup></b> shortest path which could be either <b>5
</b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
4 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
3 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
2 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
5 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
1 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span>
2</b> or <b>5 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 1 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 2 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 5 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 4 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 3 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>®</span></span> 2</b>, each with length 15.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in'><span
style='font-size:4.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div align=center>

  </td>

  </td>

  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 1 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 4 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 3 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2</p>
  </td>
  <td width=63 valign=top style='width:47.5pt;border:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:center'>15</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=300 valign=top style='width:225.0pt;border:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 4 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 3 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 4 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 3 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2</p>
  </td>
  <td width=63 valign=top style='width:47.5pt;border:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:center'>16</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=300 valign=top style='width:225.0pt;border:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 1 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 1 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 5 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 1 <span
  style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
  style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>®</span></span> 2</p>
  </td>
  <td width=63 valign=top style='width:47.5pt;border:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:center'>23</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>Given a
description of the graph, source vertex <b><i>x</i></b>, target vertex <b><i>y</i></b>,
and the value of <b><i>k</i></b>, you need to find out the length of the path <i>Abul</i>
computed. You may assume that there exists at least one path from <b><i>x</i></b>
to <b><i>y </i></b>in the given graph.</p>

<h5><span class=stylearial16pt><span style='mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></h5>

<h5><span class=stylearial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>The input may
contain multiple test cases. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>The first line
of each test case contains two integers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n (2 </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'> n </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>£</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'> 100)</span></b>
and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>m (1 </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>£</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'> m </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'> 1000)</span></b> giving respectively the
number of vertices, and the number of edges in the graph. Each vertex in the
graph is identified by a unique integer in <b>[1, n]</b>. The second line of
the test case contains the values of <b><i>x</i></b>, <b><i>y</i></b> and <b>k
(1 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
x, y </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
100, x </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>¹</span></span>
y, 2 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
k </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
10)</b>. Each of the next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>m</span></b> lines contains three integers <b>u</b>,
<b>v</b> and <b>l</b> <b>(1 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>£</span></span> <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>u</i><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>,</span><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>
v</i> </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
100, 0 </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span>
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>l</i> </b><b><span style='font-family:
Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:
symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span> 10000) </b>specifying a
directed edge of length <b>l</b> from vertex <b>u<i> </i></b>to vertex <b>v</b>.
</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>The input
terminates with two zeros for <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>m</i></b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h4><span class=stylearial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output
</span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case in the input
output a line containing an integer giving the length of the <b>k</b><sup>th</sup>
shortest path in the graph. If the graph does not have at least <b>k<i> </i></b>paths
from <b>x</b> to <b>y</b>, output a <b>1</b> instead.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Output for Sample Input</span></b><o:p></o:p></h1>

 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";layout-grid-mode:line'>3 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

  "Courier New";layout-grid-mode:line'>1 3 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<title>Problem B - Magic Cube</title>
