 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>
<p class=MsoTitle><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problem C</span><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Broken Keyboard</span><br>
<span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Input:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:
normal'> standard input<br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:
normal'> standard output<br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Time
Limit: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;
font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal'>1 second</span><span style='font-size:
28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><o:wrapblock><v:shapetype
  id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
  path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
  <v:formulas>
   <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
  </v:formulas>
  <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
  <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
 </v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
  left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:108pt;margin-top:87.6pt;width:225pt;
  height:81.75pt;z-index:1;mso-position-horizontal:absolute;
  mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;mso-position-vertical:absolute;
  mso-position-vertical-relative:text'>
  <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10761.jpg"  o:title=" />
  <w:wrap type="topAndBottom"/>
 </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><span style='mso-ignore:vglayout'>
 <table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0>
  <tr>
   <td width=144 height=0></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
   <td></td>
   <td><img width=300 height=109 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10761.jpg"  v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"></td>
  </tr>
 </table>
 </span><![endif]><!--[if gte vml 1]></o:wrapblock><![endif]--><br
style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>
<span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:normal'>Certain
letter keys on a keyboard are broken but all non-letter keys are fully
functional. Yet we have to type a text and we would like to know how many
complete lines of the text we can type. Additionally, we would like to know
which other letter keys can be broken such that we still can type the same
lines from the text.<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Your program should read input from <tt><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>standard input</span></tt>.
The input includes a number of cases. The first line of each case lists a
sequence of letters whose keys are broken. The following lines contain the text
that we would like to type. This text ends with the following line <span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre style='text-align:justify'>END<o:p></o:p></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>which should be also processed.
No line of input is longer than 80 characters. The input is terminated by a
case whose first line is <o:p></o:p></p>

<pre style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>finish <o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-weight:normal'>and this case is not to be processed.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-family:Arial'>Output</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p>The output should be formatted as a table, see the sample output. The header
of the table occupies 4 lines and is shown below following an additional line
numbering character positions; this line is not a part of the header. <span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre>12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789<o:p></o:p></pre><pre>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></pre><pre>| Keyboard | # of printable | Additionally, the following |<o:p></o:p></pre><pre>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">          </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">      </span>lines<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">     </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>letter keys can be broken<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>|<o:p></o:p></pre><pre>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal>In the remaining rows of the table, you should output two
lines for each case of input in the following format, see also the sample
output. <o:p></o:p></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l0 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>The first column of the table
     reports the number of the keyboard. Keyboards are numbered sequentially,
     starting with 1. This number should be printed right adjusted at
     characters 5-7 of the line. There will be no more that 999 keyboards in
     the input file. <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l0 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>The second column of the
     table reports how many lines of the text of this case can be typed with
     our broken keyboard. This number should be printed right adjusted at
     characters 19-21 of the line. There will be no more that 999 lines of text
     in each case. <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l0 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>The third column of the table
     reports which additional letter keys can be broken such that we still can
     type the lines reported in column two. The additional letter keys should
     be listed as a sequence of small letters in alphabetic order starting at
     the 31st character of the line. <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l0 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>The second line of output for
     each case is a horizontal line as shown in the sample output. <o:p></o:p></li>
</ul>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-weight:normal'>The only white-space characters used in the table
are space and new-line.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h1><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=643 bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:6.7in;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=643 valign=top style='width:6.7in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Xyz<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>We will work with a basic time unit of an eighth-note. At any<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>given time, your left foot and right foot will each be on distinct<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>arrows. Only one foot may perform an action (changing arrows and/or<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>tapping) during any time unit; jumping is not allowed. Also, you must<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>remain facing forward in order to see the screen. This puts<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>limitations on which feet you can use to hit which arrows. Finally,<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>hitting two arrows in a row with the same foot (&quot;double-tapping&quot;) is<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>exhausting, because you can't shift your weight onto that<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>foot. Ideally, you want to alternate feet all the way through a string<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>of consecutive arrows.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>END<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>life<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>is <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>sometimes<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>tough<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>END<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>but<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>one <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>must <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>not <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>give <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>up<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>END<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>finish<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h1><span style='color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<h1><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial;font-style:normal'>Output for Sample Input</span></b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=643 valign=top style='width:6.7in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>| Keyboard | # of printable | Additionally, the following |<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>| <span style="mso-spacerun: yes">         </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">      </span>lines<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">     </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>letter keys can be broken<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>|<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">     </span>1<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">    </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">        </span>4<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">       </span>| jkq<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                         </span>|<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">     </span>2<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">    </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">      </span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>1<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">       </span>| abcdjkmnpqrsvwxyz<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">           </span>|<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">     </span>3<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">    </span>|<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">        </span>3<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">       </span>| acfhjklmpqrswxyz<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">            </span>|<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>+----------+----------------+-----------------------------+<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1031"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:LatentStyles DefLockedState="false" LatentStyleCount="156">  </w:LatentStyles>
</xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:65.2pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span lang=SV
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Treasure
Castle</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>
standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output:</span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>
standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 1 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=SV
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
lang=SV>The treasure hunting chapter of iCORE (international Conference of
Revolver Enthusiasts) has just acquired a map of a castle which is now in ruins
but its cellars contain an unimaginable treasure. The map is drawn on an
orthogonal integer lattice. The coordinates of the lower left corner of the
lattice are (-10000,&nbsp;-10000) while the coordinates of the upper right
corner are (10000,&nbsp;10000). The external walls of the castle are either
horizontal or vertical and always span a distance between the towers of the
castle. Walls do not cross and if they have a point in common then it is a
tower of the castle. Exactly two walls meet at each tower. The towers are
located at grid points. The grid lines not outside the walls of the castle
correspond to underground corridors. The map indicates that at one of the grid
points there is an entrance to the underground corridors and that at another
grid point the long sought for treasure is to be found. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><o:wrapblock><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
  coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
  filled="f" stroked="f">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
  <v:formulas>
   <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
   <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
   <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
  </v:formulas>
  <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
  <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
 </v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1027" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
  margin-left:126pt;margin-top:25.8pt;width:225pt;height:175.3pt;z-index:1;
  mso-position-horizontal:absolute;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;
  mso-position-vertical:absolute;mso-position-vertical-relative:text'>
  <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./d_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
  <w:wrap type="topAndBottom"/>
 </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><span style='mso-ignore:vglayout'>
 <table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 align=left>
  <tr>
   <td width=168 height=0></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
   <td></td>
   <td><img width=300 height=234 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/./d_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_s1027"></td>
  </tr>
 </table>
 </span><![endif]><!--[if gte vml 1]></o:wrapblock><![endif]--><br
style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>
<span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:
EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<br style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
task is to compute the shortest path that leads from the entrance to the
treasure through the underground corridors. You can switch corridors at grid
points. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
attached figure illustrates the castle of the first case of sample input. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
input file contains multiple cases. The first line of each case contains an
integer number <em>n</em>, 4&nbsp;&#8804;&nbsp;<em>n</em>&nbsp;&#8804;&nbsp;5000,
which is the number of towers in the castle. In each of the next <em>n</em>
lines there are two integers giving the <em>x</em> and <em>y</em> coordinates
of a tower. There is a wall between any two subsequent towers and there is a
wall between the first and the last listed towers. The last two lines of input
give the <em>x and y</em> integer coordinates of the entrance and the treasure,
respectively. </span><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
input is terminated by a case with <em>n</em>&nbsp;=&nbsp;0 and this case
should not be processed. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span lang=SV><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h1 style='text-align:justify'><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>For
each case of input, output one line following the format from the sample
output. The castles are numbered by subsequent integers starting from 1. For each
castle, print its number followed by a colon and after one space print one
integer giving the shortest distance in grid units between the entrance and the
treasure along the underground corridors.</span><span lang=SV style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-font-kerning:0pt;font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<h1><span lang=SV>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                               </span>Output for Sample Input</span><span
lang=SV style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=322 valign=top style='width:3.35in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>9 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>9 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>12 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>12 9<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 9<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>8 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>8 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>11 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><span
  lang=SV style='mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=322 valign=top style='width:3.35in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span

  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Castle 2: 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

  ZH-CN'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoCaption><span lang=SV>Problem setter: Krzysztof Diks</span></p>

Rudnicki <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>

 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Foreign Exchange</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 1 second<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Your non-profit organization (<span
class=SpellE><b>iCORE</b></span> - <b>i</b>nternational <b>C</b>onfederation of
<b>R</b>evolver <b>E</b>nthusiasts) coordinates a very successful foreign
student exchange program. Over the last few years, demand has sky-rocketed and
now you need assistance with your task. <span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The program your organization runs works as
follows: All candidates are asked for their original location and the location
they would like to go to. The program works out only if every student has a
suitable exchange partner. In other words, if a student wants to go from A to
B, there must be another student who wants to go from B to A. This was an easy
task when there were only about 50 candidates, however now there are up to <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>500000</b> candidates! </p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains multiple
cases. Each test case will consist of a line containing <b>n</b> - the number
of candidates <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(1&#8804;<span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>n</span>&#8804;500000)</b>, followed by <b>n</b>
lines representing the exchange information for each candidate. Each of these
lines will contain <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b> integers,
separated by a single space, representing the candidate's original location and
the candidate's target location respectively. Locations will be represented by
nonnegative integer numbers. You may assume that no candidate will have his or
her original location being the same as his or her target location as this
would fall into the domestic exchange program. The input is terminated by a
case where <b>n</b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&nbsp;=&nbsp;0</b>;
this case should not be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test
case, print <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;YES&quot;</b> on a
single line if there is a way for the exchange program to work out, otherwise
print <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;NO&quot;</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem F</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-font-kerning:18.0pt'>Signed Digit Numbers</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 2 seconds</span><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='position:absolute;
 left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:414.3pt;margin-top:2.1pt;width:82.5pt;
 height:112.5pt;z-index:1;mso-wrap-distance-left:15pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:15pt;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:15pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:15pt;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10764.jpg"  o:title="smallprint"/>
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=110 height=150
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10764.jpg"  align=left hspace=20 vspace=20 v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"><![endif]>Typically,
in a base <i>b</i> number system the digit set is </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>{ 0</span>, 1,
..., <i>b</i>-1 } </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>However, it is possible to allow a digit set with negative
digits </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>{ -</span><i>a</i>, -(<i>a</i>-1), ...,
-1, 0, 1, ..., (<i>a</i>-1), <i>a</i> } </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>with</span> appropriately chosen <i>a</i>.
In the sequel, the negative digits will be written <span class=GramE>as <span
style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'d</span></span>
when <span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>d</span>
is a positive digit, such that a negative digit occupies two characters in a
recording of a number. For example, with <i>b</i>&nbsp;=&nbsp;10 and <i>a</i>&nbsp;=&nbsp;6
we have the following digits </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>{<span style='font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'6</span>, <span
style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'5</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'4</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'3</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'2</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>'1</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4</span>,
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5</span>,
<span class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>6</span> }</span> </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>The resulting number system is called <i>signed-digit</i>
system and in order to make the parameters explicit we call it <span
class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>b, a)</i> system, in the case above <i>SD(10,
6)</i>. Computing a number from its representation in an <i>SD</i> system is
the same as in usual number systems, just some digits have negative values. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>Using two digits in <span class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>10,
6)</i> we can record all the numbers in the range '6'6..66, i.e. in the usual
decimal notation the range is -66<span class=GramE>..66</span>, but with the
new digits we do not need a sign for the entire number. The <i>SD</i> systems
are redundant in that a number can have more than one representation. For
example, in <span class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>10, 6)</i> the decimal number
4 has at least two representations: <span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4</span> and <span style='font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1'6</span>. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>The redundancy of <span class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>b,&nbsp;a)</i>
number system allows to design faster algorithms for addition. If the following
conditions are satisfied </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>ceil(</span>(<i>b</i>+1)/2)
&lt;= <i>a</i> &lt;= <i>b</i>-1 </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>we</span> can choose one of the available
representations of each number in such a way that we can design an algorithm
for addition which runs in constant time as the carry propagation can be
eliminated. However, we will not be concerned with carry propagation here. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>Your task is simple. Given a number <i>n</i> in usual
decimal notation fitting into a 32-bit integer, a positive <i>b</i>&nbsp;&lt;=&nbsp;10
and <i>a</i> satisfying the conditions stated above, you are asked to convert <i>n</i>
into its <span class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>b,&nbsp;a)</i> representation
where the negative digits are recorded as explained above. If <i>n</i> has more
than one representation in <span class=GramE><i>SD(</i></span><i>b,&nbsp;a)</i>,
then anyone will do. </p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains a
sequence of lines, each line contains three numbers: <em>n</em>, <em>b</em> and
<em>a</em>. The last line of input has <em>b</em>&nbsp;=&nbsp;0 and should not
be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce
one line of output containing a representation of <em>n</em> in <span
class=GramE><em>SD(</em></span><em>b,&nbsp;a)</em>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                           </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=295 valign=top style='width:221.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

	mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;}
p.MsoCaption, li.MsoCaption, div.MsoCaption
	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;
	color:windowtext;
	font-weight:bold;}

	{margin:0in;

  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem G</span></b><b><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN;font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Doves and Bombs<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
 left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:270.45pt;margin-top:5.75pt;width:224.55pt;
 height:177.45pt;z-index:1'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10765.jpg"  o:title=" />
 <w:wrap type="square" anchorx="page"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=299 height=236
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10765.jpg"  align=left hspace=12 v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"><![endif]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:windowtext'>It is the year 95 ACM (After the Crash of Microsoft). After
many years of peace, a war has broken out. Your nation, the <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceType w:st="on">island</st1:PlaceType>
of <st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Evergreen Macros And Confusing Shortcuts</st1:PlaceName></st1:place>
(EMACS), is defending itself against the railway empire ruled by Visually
Impaired Machinists (VIM). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>In the days leading up to the outbreak of
war, your government devoted a great deal of resources toward gathering
intelligence on VIM. It discovered the following: <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>The empire has a large network of railway stations
     connected by bidirectional tracks. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>Before the outbreak of the war, each railway station
     was directly connected to at most 10 other stations. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>Information is constantly being exchanged in VIM, but,
     due to a design flaw, the only way it can be exchanged is to send the
     messages by train. Before the outbreak of the war, it was possible to send
     a message by train from any station to any other station. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>As a last resort, the empire's central command can send
     messages by carrier pigeon, but it tries to avoid this at all costs, as
     the only pigeons suitable for the job must be imported, at great expense,
     from the far-away <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceType w:st="on">land</st1:PlaceType>
     of <st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Pigeons In Courier Outfits</st1:PlaceName></st1:place>
     (PICO). <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
     "Times New Roman"'>Once a pigeon has delivered a message to a railway
     station, it must rest, and thus cannot be used again. If a pigeon has
     delivered a broadcast message to a particular station, the message is
     passed on, if possible, by train. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Based on this information, the government
of EMACS has come up with a plan to disrupt the activities of the evil empire.
They will send bomber planes to bomb the railway stations, thus hampering
communications in the empire. This will necessitate to acquire many carrier
pigeons by the empire, distracting it from its deadly wartime activities. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>Unfortunately, your government spent so
much money on gathering intelligence that it has a very limited amount left to
build bombs. As a result, it can bomb only one target. You have been charged
with the task of determining the best candidate railway stations in the empire
to bomb, based on their &quot;pigeon value&quot;. The &quot;pigeon value&quot;
of a station is the minimum number of pigeons that after bombing this station,
will be required to broadcast a message from the empire central command to all
non-bombed stations. The location of the empire central command is unknown but
we know that it is not located at a railway station. This implies, that when
the central command needs to send a message to some non-bombed station they have
to use at least one pigeon and then the message can be further transmitted by
the railway. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4>Input<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains several test cases. The
data for each case begins with a line containing the following two integers: </p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .5in'><em>n</em>
     the number of railway stations in the empire (3&nbsp;<span
     style='font-family:SimSun;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#8804;</span>&nbsp;<em>n</em>&nbsp;<span
     style='font-family:SimSun;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#8804;</span>&nbsp;10000).
     The stations will be numbered starting from 0, up to <em> n-1&nbsp;</em>.
     </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .5in'><em>m</em>
     the number of stations to be identified as candidate bombing targets
     (1&nbsp;<span style='font-family:SimSun;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#8804;</span>&nbsp;<em>m</em>&nbsp;<span
     style='font-family:SimSun;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#8804;</span>&nbsp;<em>n</em>).
     </li>
</ul>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Next few lines consists of pairs of integers.
Each pair (<em>x</em>,<em>y</em>) indicates the presence of a bidirectional
railway line connecting railway stations <em>x</em> and <em>y</em>. <span
style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span>This sequence is terminated by a line
containing two minus 1 as shown in the sample input.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Input is terminated by a case where the value of
n=m=0. This case should not be processed.</p>

<h4>Output</h4>

<!--pre style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'--><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black'>For each case of input the output should give <i>m</i> most desirable railway stations to bomb. There should be exactly <i>m</i> lines, each with two integers separated by a single space. The first integer on each line will be the number of a railway station, and the second will be the &quot;pigeon value&quot; of the station. This list should be sorted, first by &quot;pigeon value&quot;, in descending order, and within the same &quot;pigeon value&quot; by railway station numbers, in ascending order. Print a blank line after the output for each set of input.<o:p></o:p></span><!--/pre--><pre
style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:
SimSun'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>3 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>3 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>-1 -1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>2 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>3 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>4 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>0 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext;
  mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in'><b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter:
</span></b><b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:windowtext'>Paul Shelly<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1028"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Organising the Organisation<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Second</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>I am the chief of the Personnel
Division of a moderate-sized company that wishes to remain anonymous, and I am
currently facing a small problem for which I need a skilled programmer's help. <span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<center><img width=291 height=270 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10766a.jpg"  ></center>

<br
style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>
Currently, our company is divided into several more or less independent
divisions. In order to make our business more efficient, these need to be
organised in a hierarchy, indicating which divisions are in charge of other
divisions. For instance, if there are four divisions A, B, C and D we could
organise them as in Figure 1, with division A controlling divisions B and D,
and division D controlling division C. <o:p></o:p></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<br style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>

<p style='text-align:justify'>One of the divisions is Central Management
(division A in the figure above), and should of course be at the top of the
hierarchy, but the relative importance of the remaining divisions is not
determined, so in Figure 1 above, division C and D could equally well have
switched places so that C was in charge over division D. One complication,
however, is that it may be impossible to get some divisions to cooperate with
each other, and in such a case, neither of these divisions can be directly in
charge of the other. For instance, if in the example above A and D are unable
to cooperate, Figure 1 is not a valid way to organise the company. <span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>In general, there can of course be many different
ways to organise the organisation, and thus it is desirable to find the best
one (for instance, it is not a good idea to let the programming people be in
charge of the marketing people). This job, however, is way too complicated for
you, and your job is simply to help us find out how much to pay the consultant
that we hire to find the best organisation for us. In order to determine the
consultant's pay, we need to find out exactly how difficult the task is, which
is why you have to count exactly <i>how many</i> different ways there are to
organise the organisation. <o:p></o:p></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Oh, and I need the answer in five hours. <o:p></o:p></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input consists of a series of test cases, at
most <b>50</b>, terminated by end-of-file. Each test cases begins with three
integers <b>n, m, k (1 &#8804; n &#8804; 50, 0 &#8804; m &#8804; 1500, 1 &#8804; k &#8804; n)</b>. <b>n</b> denotes the number of divisions in the company (for
convenience, the divisions are numbered from <b>1</b> to <b>n</b>), and <b>k</b>
indicates which division is the Central Management division. This is followed
by <b>m</b> lines, each containing two integers <b>1 &#8804; i, j &#8804; n</b>,
indicating that division <b>i</b> and division <b>j</b> cannot cooperate (thus,
<b>i</b> cannot be directly in charge of <b>j</b> and <b>j</b> cannot be
directly in charge of <b>i</b>). You may assume that <b>i</b> and <b>j</b> are
always different. <span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test
case, print the number of possible ways to organise the company on a line by
itself. This number will be at least <b>1</b> and at most <b>10<sup>15</sup></b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 5 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=297 valign=top style='width:222.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>8<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>
<center><img width=569 height=272
 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/107/p10766a.jpg" ></center>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<br style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

color:windowtext'>Problem setter: Per Austrin<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>
