	{margin-bottom:0in;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4097"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Planet of the Rock, Paper and Scissors</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p>It's the twenty-fifth century now and space exploration finaly came to full
maturity. Recently, on a small green planet in one of the neighboring spiral
arms of our galaxy, a hitherto unknown species was discovered. Obeying
interplanetary laws, earth scientists are allowed to study this new species,
but they can not interfere in any way with them. So they use large telescopes
and study it's behaviour from one of the planet's moons.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>The preliminary research reveal the following facts: </p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l1 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>Every individual belongs to
     one of three races. The names for these races given by the scientists are
     &quot;Rock&quot;, &quot;Paper&quot; and &quot;Scissors&quot;. (If you
     think that these names are strange, take a 101 course is quantum
     chromodynamics). </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l1 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>Indiviuals from different races
     look exactly alike, but when two individuals from different races meet
     each other the difference becomes clear. During the encounter one
     individual completely dominates the other according to the following
     rules: </li>
 <ul type=circle>
  <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
      auto;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo5;tab-stops:list 1.0in'>Rock dominates
      Scissors; </li>
  <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
      auto;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo5;tab-stops:list 1.0in'>Scissors dominates
      Paper; </li>
  <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
      auto;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo5;tab-stops:list 1.0in'>Paper dominates Rock. </li>
 </ul>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l1 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>Encounters between
     individuals of the same race never happen. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l1 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .5in'>Individuals live in closed
     communities of varying sizes. There are no encounters between individuals
     of different communities. </li>
</ul>

<p>To study the new species, the communities are permanently observed by the
telescopes. The images are interpreted by special tracking software that
registers the moves of every individual. Everytime an encounter between two
individuals occurs, this fact is recorded, together with information about
which individual dominates during the encounter.</p>

<p>Your task is to write a program that reads the records and decides wether it
is possible to uniquely determine the race of every individual within a
community under study, once an arbitrary race is assigned to one of the
individuals.</p>

<h4><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The first line gives the number of
communities studied (max. 1000).</span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB><br>
For each community there is a line containing the number of individuals within
the community (max. 5000), and the number of encounters recorded, followed by
the records of each encounter. A record has the format (M&gt;N), which means
that the individual numbered M dominates the individual numbered N. Individuals
are numbered uniquely by the tracking software from 1 to S, where S is the community
size. The records are grouped in lines, with a maximum of ten per line. No
whitespace, apart from the line breaks will occur.</span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB><br>
You may assume that every member of a community is engaged in an encounter at
least once.</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.5pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-fareast-language:
ZH-CN'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal>Per community in the input file one line stating the
community number (numbering sequentially from 1) followed by one of three
statements (without the quotes): <span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l2 level1 lfo8;tab-stops:list .5in'>&quot;Observation
     Complete&quot;. Although the races can't be determined by direct
     observation, once we arbitrarily assign a race to one individual, the race
     of every other individual can be uniquely determined. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l2 level1 lfo8;tab-stops:list .5in'>&quot;Not Enough Data&quot;.
     The race of one or more individuals can't be determined, even though we
     assign the race of one individual arbitrarily. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     mso-list:l2 level1 lfo8;tab-stops:list .5in'>&quot;Conflicting
     Records&quot;. Something went wrong during the observations, the
     assignment of the races leads to a conflict. </li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>See the sample output for the exact format.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The results &quot;Not Enough Data&quot; and
&quot;Conflicting Records&quot; can occur simultaniously. In this situation
your program should report &quot;Conflicting Records&quot; because the
observations for this community will have to be redone from scratch.</p>

<pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:
SimSun'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                        </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<div align=center>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="101%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:101.9%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="56%" valign=top style='width:56.84%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<br>
  7 6<br>
  (6&gt;1)(6&gt;2)(6&gt;3)(1&gt;4)(2&gt;5)(5&gt;7)<br>
  9 11<br>
  (8&gt;4)(8&gt;2)(8&gt;6)(4&gt;3)(2&gt;3)(2&gt;1)(6&gt;1)(3&gt;8)(1&gt;8)<br>
  (5&gt;7)(7&gt;9)<br>
  6 8<br>
  (3&gt;1)(3&gt;2)(3&gt;4)(1&gt;2)(4&gt;2)(2&gt;5)(2&gt;6)(6&gt;4)<br>
  8 7<br>
  (1&gt;2)(2&gt;3)(3&gt;4)(4&gt;5)<br>
  (6&gt;7)(7&gt;8)(6&gt;8)</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="43%" valign=top style='width:43.16%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre
  style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Community 1: Observation Complete<br
  style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
  <![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
  <![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman"'>Community 2: Not Enough Data<br style='mso-special-character:
  line-break'>
  <![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
  <![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman"'>Community 3: Conflicting Records<br style='mso-special-character:
  line-break'>
  <![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
  <![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman"'>Community 4: Conflicting Records</span><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
  mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'>Problem setter: Little Joey <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS";mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Special Thanks:
Derek Kisman<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS";mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoHeading9>Explanation</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'>For Community
1 we arbitrarily assign Rock to individual 6. Because individuals 1, 2 and 3
are dominated by it, they should be Scissors. Now individuals 4 and 5 are both
dominated by a Scissors, which means they are Paper. Finaly individual 7 is
dominated by individual 5 (a Paper) so it's a Rock. We now have 2 Rocks (6 and
7), 3 Scissors (1, 2 and 3) and 2 Papers (4 and 5), so all individuals are
assigned a race and no conflicts occured. The result is therefore
&quot;Observation Complete&quot;.<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'>In Community 2
we can arbitrarily assign Paper to individual 8, which makes 2, 4 and 6 Rock
and 1 and 3 Scissors. Although there are redundant observations in the input,
they don't lead to conflicts. However we can not determine the races of 5, 7
and 9, although we know their mutual dominations, so the result is &quot;Not
Enough Data&quot;.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'><br>
The first three observations of Community 3 would lead to the conclusion that individuals
1, 2 and 4 are Paper after arbitrarily assigning Scissors to individual 3. The
fact however that 1 dominates 2 leads to &quot;Conflicting Records&quot;.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'>The records
for Community 4 lead to both &quot;Not Enough Data&quot; and &quot;Conflicting
Records&quot;. According to the rules, &quot;Conflicting Records&quot; is
printed.<span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

<title>Problem D - Of Circles and Squares</title>

	mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;

p.MsoHeading8, li.MsoHeading8, div.MsoHeading8
	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0in;

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4097"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Of Circles and Squares</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>&nbsp;</p>
<center>
<img width=378 height=272
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10823.jpg" ></center>

<p>We
have placed a number of circles and squares on an infinite stretch of a 2D
plane. These circles and squares come in various sizes and colors. But when we
place more than one object together, the color in the common region of those
objects becomes a mixture of the original color. We define the color of each
geometric object by the 8 bit value of the Red, Green and Blue components. For
example, a circle drawn in pure red would have the color (255,0,0). The
borderline of each geometric object is drawn in black (0,0,0), and the empty
spaces are always white (255,255,255). Given a number of such geometric objects
and some points in the 2D plane, your task is to determine the color of the
points. The color of a point is computed as the average red, average green and
average blue values of the geometric objects that this point falls into. If the
point is on the borderline of any of the geometric object, then its color would
be black; if it falls in the empty space, the color of the point would be
white.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h4 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
first line of input gives you the number of test cases T (T&#8804;100) to
follow. Each test case starts with two integers, R and P. R (R&#8804;100) is
the number of geometric objects and P (P&#8804;100) is the number of query
points. Then there will be R lines describing the objects. The description of
each geometric object follows the object_type px py length r g b format.
object_type is the type of the geometric object, which can be CIRCLE or
SQUARE. px and py (-1000&#8804;px,py&#8804;+1000) are two integers giving you
the x and y coordinate of the center of the circle or the lower left corner of
the square depending on the object type. length (0&#8804;length&#8804;2000) is
the radius of the circle or the length of a side if it is a square. The r, g
and b (0&#8804;r,g,b&#8804;255) values are integers giving you the color of the
object. The description of the query points starts after the description of the
objects. Each query point is denoted by an integer pair px and py
(-1000&#8804;px,py&#8804;+1000) giving you the x and y coordinate of that
point.<span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test case, print the
serial number of the test case first. Then for each of the query points, print the
color of that point in one line. All the colors are to be rounded to the
nearest integer (for example: 128.3 will be rounded to 128, 128.5 will be
rounded to 129 and 128.7 will also be rounded to 129). There must be a blank
line separating two test cases. Please consult the sample input/output section
for the exact format.<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                  </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

  "Courier New"'>6 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>8 5</span></b><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:

  <td width="49%" valign=top style='width:49.42%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'>Problem setter: Monirul Hasan<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'>Special Thanks: Shahriar Manzoor<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4097"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Regular Polygon</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=SV>&nbsp;</span><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>A regular polygon is an n-sided
polygon in which the sides are all the same length and are symmetrically placed
about a common center (i.e., the polygon is both equiangular and equilateral).
Only certain regular polygons are &quot;constructible&quot; using the classical
Greek tools of the compass and straightedge. The terms equilateral triangle and
square refer to the regular 3- and 4-polygons, respectively.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>The picture below shows some regular
polygons with different number of sides:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<center><img width=624 height=126 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10824.jpg" ></center>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<br style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Given N(0&lt;N</span><span
lang=EN-GB>&#8804;</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>2000)
points on a particular circle, your job is to find out how many regular
polygons of different number of edges are formed by these points. For example
if you are given 100 points, then these 100 points will form a regular hexagon
if six of these 100 points are the vertices of a regular hexagon.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=paragraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
input file contains at most 10 sets of inputs. The description of each set is
given below. The input file contains at most 20000 lines in total.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB>The first line of each set is an integer N(0&lt;N&#8804;2000) which
indicates how many points are there in this set. Each of the next N lines
contains two floating-point numbers, which is the Cartesian coordinate of a
point (Accurate to at least nine decimal places). You can assume that all the
points lie on the same circle, the center of this circle is the origin, and the
coordinate of any two points will not be the same. Also a</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>ssume that two points are same if
their angular distance with respect to the centre of the circle is less than 10<sup>-8</sup>
radian.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Input
is terminated by a set where the value of N is zero. This set should not be
processed.<span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
each set of input produce one or more lines of output. First line of the output
for each set contains the serial of output as shown in the output for sample
input. Each of the next few lines will contain two integers S and F, where S
denotes the number of sides of a regular polygon and F denotes how many times
it is formed by the input points. These outputs should be sorted in ascending
order of S. The regular polygons, which are not formed by the input points,
should not be reported. For example, in case of the second sample input no
regular pentagon (5-gon) is formed, so it is not reported in the output.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                </span>Output for Sample Input</span></b><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS";font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;

 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign=top style='width:49.84%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;

  mso-layout-grid-align:none'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:

  </td>
  <td width="50%" valign=top style='width:50.16%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span

@list l1
	{mso-list-id:1497722185;
	mso-list-type:hybrid;
	mso-list-template-ids:-1822937996 -1049589590 -2085436444 2105694210 -772223676 1203911802 -2114417654 -707778252 346222828 1039183094;}
@list l1:level1
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Symbol;}
@list l1:level2
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:o;
	mso-level-tab-stop:1.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
@list l2
	{mso-list-id:1900164199;
	mso-list-type:hybrid;
	mso-list-template-ids:172551054 742395688 -187134580 -825488138 -1202304838 1406420756 789627484 -452545964 -1154055322 1380753788;}

	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;

</style>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4097"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Anagram and Multiplication</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:
</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Input</span><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Output: </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=paragraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>There
are some amazing M-digit, N-based numbers which when multiplied by 2, 3, 
M,
results in new numbers which are just anagrams of the original number. For
example 142857 is such a 6-digit decimal (10-based) number as shown below:</p>

<pre style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>2 x 142,857 = 285,714<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>3 x 142,857 = 428,571<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>4 x 142,857 = 571,428<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>5 x 142,857 = 714,285<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>6 x 142,857 = 857,142<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=paragraph style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>Given the value of M and N
your job is to find such a number. Without any proof I can assure you that for
a single pair of value of M and N there is at most one such number.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h4 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>The input file contains maximum 30 lines
of input.<o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=paragraph style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>Each line contains two integers
M(3&#8804;M&#8804;6) and N(4&#8804;N&#8804;400). The meaning of M and N is
given in the problem statement.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Input
is terminated by a line where M=N=0<b>.</b> This case should not be processed.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>For each line of input you should produce one line of output. This line
should contain M integers separated by a single space. All these integers are within
0 and N-1 (inclusive). These integers are the values of digits of the required
N-based amazing number. The digits should be printed in descending order of
significance (The left most integer is the value of the most significant digit
and the rightmost integer is the value of the least significant digit of the
desired number). If there is no such N based M-digit number print the string
Not found. (without the quotes) instead. Look at the output for sample input
for details.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">    </span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">        </span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                       </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" style='width:100.0%;
 border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.76%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>6 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>6 100<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><o:p></o:p></b></pre></td>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.24%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;background:silver;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 4 2 8 5 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Not found.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem G</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Hot
or Cold?</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><br>
<span lang=SV style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:SV;mso-fareast-language:
SV'>You are playing a number-guessing game with a friend.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>He is thinking of an integer between 1 and N
inclusive.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>You have unlimited guesses
to figure it out, but of course you want to do it in as few guesses as
possible.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>He won't actually tell you if
you guess correctly; the only information he will give you is that, on every
guess except the first, he will say &quot;warmer&quot; or &quot;colder&quot;
depending on whether this guess is nearer or farther than the previous guess.
(If the distance is exactly the same, either may be said)<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>When you are certain that your last guess
was correct, you tell your friend, winning the game.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=SV style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:SV;mso-fareast-language:
SV'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=SV style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:SV;mso-fareast-language:
SV'>Note that your guesses must all be genuine guesses, consistent with all the
information you have.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>You can't guess a
number that has no chance of being correct, even though you might want to!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=SV style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:SV;mso-fareast-language:
SV'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=SV style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:SV;mso-fareast-language:
SV'>At worst, how many guesses will it take you?</span></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Every
case consists of a line containing N, 1&#8804;N&#8804;300.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>Input will end on a case where N=0.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>This case should not be processed.<span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>For
each case, output a line containing the maximum number of guesses it should
take to guess the number.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                </span>Output for Sample Input</span></b><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS";font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="98%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:98.44%;margin-left:.05in;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;
 border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign=top style='width:49.9%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>75<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>75<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="50%" valign=top style='width:50.1%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>10 guess(es) required.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>10 guess(es) required.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Maximum sum on a torus</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>A
grid that wraps both horizontally and vertically is called a torus. Given a
torus where each cell contains an integer, determine the sub-rectangle with the
largest sum. The sum of a sub-rectangle is the sum of all the elements in that
rectangle. The grid below shows a torus where the maximum sub-rectangle has
been shaded.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>The first line in the input contains the number of
test cases (at most 18). Each case starts with an integer N
(1&#8804;N&#8804;75) specifying the size of the torus (always square). Then
follows N lines describing the torus, each line containing N integers between
-100 and 100, inclusive.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test case, output a
line containing a single integer: the maximum sum of a sub-rectangle within the
torus.<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input <span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                 </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.8%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 -1 0 0 -4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2 3 -2 -3 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 1 -1 5 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 -2 1 -3 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-3 2 4 1 -4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 5 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>7 8 9</span><o:p></o:p></b></pre></td>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.2%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>15<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoHeading7 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'>45<span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4097"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem I</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Back to Kernighan-Ritchie</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<center><p><img width=185 height=246
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10828a.gif"  align=left hspace=12></p>
</center>
<p>You
must have heard the name of <b>Kernighan</b> and <b>Ritchie</b>, the authors of
<i>The C Programming Language</i>. While coding in <b>C</b>, we use different
control statements and loops, such as, <i>if-then-else</i>, <i>for</i>, <i>do-while</i>,
etc. Consider the following fragment of pseudo code: </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">   </span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'>//execution starts here<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">   </span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'>do {<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">      </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>U</b>;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">      </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>V</b>;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  
</span>} while(<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>condition</i>);<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>W</b>;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>In
the above code, there is a bias in each conditional branch. Such codes can be
represented by control flow graphs like below:</p>

<center><img width=328 height=138 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10828a.gif" ></center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Let
the probability of jumping from one node of the graph to any of its adjacent
nodes be <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>equal</span>. So, in the above
code fragment, the expected number of times <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>U</span> executes is <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2</span>. In
this problem, you will be given with such a control flow graph and find the
expected number of times a node is visited starting from a specific node.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Input
consists of several test cases. There will be maximum <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>100</span> test cases. Each case starts with an integer: <span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n (n &#8804; 100)</span>.
Here <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span>
is the number of nodes in the graph. Each node in the graph is labeled with <span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1</span> to<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> </i></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span> and execution always starts from <span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1</span>. Each of the next few lines has two
integers: <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>start</span>
and <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>end</span>
which means execution may jump from node <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>start</span> to node <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>end</span>. A value of zero for <span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>start</span> ends
this list. After this, there will be an integer <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>q (q &#8804; 100)</span> denoting the number
of queries to come. Next <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>q</span> lines contain a node number for which you have to evaluate the
expected number of times the node is visited. The last test case has value of
zero for <span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span>
which should not be processed.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>Output for each test case
should start with <span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Case #i:</span>
with next q lines containing the results of the queries in the input with three
decimal places. There can be situations where a node will be visited forever
(for example, an infinite <span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>for</span>
loop). In such cases, you should print <span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>infinity</span> (without the quotes). See the
sample output section for details of formatting.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                  </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="5121"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Problem J</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>L-Gap Substrings</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:
</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Input</span><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Output: </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=paragraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>If a string is in the form <b>UVU</b>, where <b>U</b>
is not empty, and <b>V</b> has exactly <b>L</b> characters, we say <b>UVU</b>
is an <b>L</b>-Gap string. For example, <b>abcbabc</b> is a <b>1</b>-Gap
string. <b>xyxyxyxyxy</b> is both a <b>2</b>-Gap string and also a <b>6</b>-Gap
string, but not a <b>10</b>-Gap string (because <b>U</b> is non-empty).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=paragraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Given a string <b>s</b>, and a positive
integer <b>g</b>, you are to find the number of <b>g</b>-Gap substrings in <b>s</b>.
<b>s</b> contains lower-case letters only, and has at most <b>50,000</b>
characters.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div align=center>

<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10829.jpg" ></center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
first line contains a single integer <b>t(1&lt;=t&lt;=10)</b>, the number of
test cases. Each of the <b>t</b> followings contains an integer <b>g(1&lt;=g&lt;=10)
</b>followed by<b> </b>a string <b>s</b>.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test case, print the
case number and the number of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>g</b>-Gap
substrings. Look at the output for sample input for details.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                               </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" style='width:100.0%;
 border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.76%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 bbaabaaaaa<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 abxxxxxab<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><o:p></o:p></b></pre></td>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.24%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;background:silver;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 1: 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 2: 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>
