</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Given the
value of <b>n</b>, it is very easy to find the value of <b>&#966;(n)</b> using
the formula below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
style='mso-text-raise:-16.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:374.25pt;
 height:57.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/./h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=499 height=77
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/./h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1172603662">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>According to
this formula <span style='mso-text-raise:-14.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:342.75pt;height:46.5pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/./h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=457 height=62
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/./h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1172603663">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>But
your task is not quite straightforward, given the value of <b>&#966;(n)</b> you
will have to find the minimum possible value of <b>n</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains at most <b>100</b>
lines of input. Each line contains a positive integer <b>phi_n</b> <b>(1&#8804;phi_n&#8804;100000000)</b>.
Input is terminated by a line where <b>phi_n=0</b>. This line should not be
processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each line
of input produce one line of output. This line contains the serial of output
followed by two integers <b>phi_n</b> and <b>n</b>. The first integer is the integer
taken as input and the second integer is the minimum possible value of <b>n</b>,
for which <b>&#966;(n)=phi_n</b>. All the input numbers will be such that for
all given input there will be a possible value of <b>n</b> less than<b>
200000000</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                    </span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">              </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.8%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>12<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>24<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>2280960<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>5000000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>0</span><o:p></o:p></b></pre></td>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.2%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  1: 12 13<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  2: 24 35<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  3: 2280960 2283989<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  4: 5000000 6265625</span></b><b><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span

	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";

	mso-fareast-language:SV;}
p
	{margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
pre
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;

	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}
tt
	{mso-ascii-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-hansi-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";}
p.paragraph, li.paragraph, div.paragraph
	{mso-style-name:paragraph;

	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	text-align:justify;

	mso-ascii-font-family:Arial;

</style>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="7169"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem I</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>The Pawn Chess</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Consider the following mini-version of chess: We
have a 4x4 chessboard, with four white pawns on the first rank (bottom line in
the input) and four black pawns on the last rank. The goal is for the player to
get one of his pawns to the other end of the board (last rank for the white
player, first rank for the black player), <i>or</i> to stalemate his opponent.
A player is stalemated if he has no legal moves when it's his turn to move
(this includes having no pawns left). </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The pawns move as in ordinary chess, except that
they can never move two steps. That is, a pawn may either move one step forward
(toward the opposite rank), assuming that this square is empty. A pawn can also
capture a pawn of the opposite color if it's one step ahead and to the left or
right. Captured pieces are removed from the game. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given the position of the pawns on a chessboard,
determine who will win the game assuming both players play optimally. You
should also determine the number of moves the game will last before it's
decided (assuming the player that will win tries to win as fast as possible and
the player to lose will lose as slow as possible). It will always be white's
turn to move from the given position. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
first line in the input contains the number of test cases (at most <b>50</b>).
Each case contains four lines describing the chessboard, preceeded by a blank
line. The first of the four lines will be the last rank of the chessboard (the
starting point for the black pawns). Black pawns will be denoted with a <b>'</b><tt><b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>p</span></b></tt><b>'</b>,
white pawns with a <b>'</b><tt><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'>P</span></b></tt><b>'</b>, and empty squares with <b>a</b>
'<tt><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>.</span></tt>'.
There will be between one and four pawns of each color. The inital position
will not be a final game position, and white will always have at least one
legal move. Note that the input position may not necessarily be one that could
have arisen from legal play from the games starting position.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test case, output a
line containing the text <tt><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>white
</span></tt><tt><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>(xx)</span></b></tt> if white will win,
or <tt><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>black </span></tt><tt><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'>(xx)</span></b></tt> if black will win. Replace <tt><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'>xx</span></b></tt> with the number of moves (which will
always be an odd number if white wins and an even number if black wins).</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                 </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;

  <td width="50%" valign=top style='width:50.58%;border:solid windowtext .5pt;

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Trebuchet MS"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<title>Problem J - The Curse of Barbosa</title>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="8193"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Problem J</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>The Curse of Barbosa</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:
</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Input</span><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Output: </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Fate it seems is never without a
twist for our beloved pirate Captain Jack Sparrow. He had just beaten the
infamous Captain Barbosa and got his ship  the Black Pearl back. But now that
he is about to set sails to conquer all that once belonged to him, he noticed
that he is yet to remove one last curse, the curse of Barbosa.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>
<center><img width=296 height=209
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/108/p10839.jpg" >
</center>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Barbosas curse said that Jack
would remain stuck within three islands (we must not utter the names, or we
will be cursed, too). We call the islands island 1, 2 and 3. Jack would have to
start from a particular island, island 1, and get back to it after visiting all
these three islands a given number of times. For example if Barbosas curse
said that Jack has to visit every island 2 times, one way to do that would be:
1-2-3-1-2-3-1. As you would notice, the island 1 comes three times because you
would have to start from there. What makes Barbosas curse even more
interesting is that Jack is not allowed to visit the islands in a reverse route
if he had already visited them in one route. For example if Jack took the
1-3-2-1-3-2-1 route, Jack is not allowed to take the 1-2-3-1-2-3-1 route.
Barbosa has also made sure that Jack cannot stay in the same island and call it
a visit, so trips like 1-2-2-3-1-3-1 are not allowed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>But we all know that for every
curse there has to be a way to undone it. And fortunately for Jack this curse
can be removed without making a single trip through the islands. All Jack has
to do is: given the number of total visits, he has to count the number of
different ways one can make the trips through these three islands.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Jack is a pirate you know. He is
smart in his pirate way, but he is certainly not a Computer geek. He is hoping
that there are some who would read his story and write a program to remove the
curse of Barbosa.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line starts with the
number of test cases, <b>T (T&#8804;40)</b>. Each of the next <b>T</b> lines
contains a single integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N
(N&#8804;100)</b>. Here <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> is the
total number of island visits that Jack has to make. You can assume that <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> will always be of form <b>3*M+1</b>,
where M is the number of times Jack has to visit island <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b> and<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> 3</b>. All trips start from island <b>1</b>,
hence we have the added <b>1</b> in the <b>3M+1</b> form.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each of the test case print one
line of output. The output for each test case starts with the test case number,
followed by the number of different ways one can visit the three islands. You
can assume that the output for each test case will take at most <b>40</b>
characters.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
