<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Problem A<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;
margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:0in;text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Strange Planet<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>As you know,
there are many strange planets in the universe. Dara and Sara are living in one
of these strange planets with an unusual coordinate system. This Planet is like
a grid having unit-sized cells with the houses considered as points placed in
the center of cells. The cells are assigned a unique number as shown in figure
1.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border:solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-top:

  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=26 style='width:19.5pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=22 style='width:16.5pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=24 style='width:.25in;border-top:none;border-left:none;border-bottom:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-top-alt:
  solid windowtext 1.5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext 1.5pt;padding:
  0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;page-break-after:
  avoid'>.</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoCaption align=center style='text-align:center'><span class=GramE>Figure
</span><!--[if supportFields]><span style='mso-element:field-begin'></span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>SEQ Figure \* ARABIC <span style='mso-element:
field-separator'></span><![endif]--><span style='mso-no-proof:yes'>1</span><!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--><span class=GramE>.</span> <span
style='font-weight:normal'>The Strange Planet<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Recently,
Dara and Sara have become familiar with the well-known Cartesian coordinate
system based on X and Y axes, and would like to know the Euclidian distance
between their houses. Unfortunately, they dont know how to calculate this
distance. So, they need your help to calculate it. You may assume that the cell
with number 0 is located at the origin (with coordinate (0, 0)) of the
Cartesian coordinate system.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b>The Input <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Input file
consists of many test-cases. Each test-case consists of two integers <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:96.75pt;
 height:12.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p0_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=129 height=17
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p0_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192911953">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>indicating the cell
numbers that contain their houses. The input will be terminated with a line
containing <span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>two -1s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b>The Output <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>For each
test-case, print the Euclidian distance between the houses of Dara and Sara
rounded to two digits after the fraction point.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 7<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>29 32<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-1
-1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1.00<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4.24<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='color:black'>
Amirkabir University of Technology - Local Contest - Round #2
</span></b><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</body>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Problem B<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;
margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:0in;text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Khepels Problem<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Khepel
(also known as <i>James the Cat, </i>see figure 1) is a handsome cat starring
in an old but well-known TV cartoon. He lives in <span class=GramE>an</span> <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:29.25pt;
 height:11.25pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=39 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912059">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>rectangular garden with
each cell being a unit-sized square. In order to keep the grass of the garden
green and beautiful, sprinklers are placed in some of the cells. Each sprinkler
can pour water in only one direction at each time instance. They continue
watering for <i>p</i> seconds in each direction and then stop pouring water, rotate
clockwise by 90 degrees (which itself takes 1 second of time) and start pouring
water in the new direction. Also, each sprinkler has a specific range <i>R</i>
which means that it can pour water on up to <i>R</i> cells away from its
position in its current direction.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>A warm
sunny day, Khepel decided to take a nap. But as you know, cats do not like to get
wet with water. As a result, he asked you to help him. In other words, given
the dimensions of his garden and the coordinates, original configuration, and
the values of <i>p</i> and <i>R</i> for each sprinkler, you must write a
program to calculate the number of cells in which he is able to sleep in his
scheduled period of time (note that Khepel can not sleep in a cell containing a
sprinkler). You must assume that all sprinklers start watering in their
original direction in the beginning of time </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:129.75pt;height:97.5pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title="James_the_Cat2" grayscale="t"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=173 height=130
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>Figure 1.</span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
Khepel trying to solve the problem<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b>The Input <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Input
consists of several test cases. The first line of each test case contains 3 integers
<sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:57.75pt;
 height:12.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=77 height=17
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912060">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>(the dimensions of the
garden), and <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1028" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:54pt;height:12.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=72 height=17
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1028"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1028"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912061">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>which is the number of
sprinklers in it. The next <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1029"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:9pt;height:12.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=12 height=17
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1029"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1029"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912062">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>lines each consist of 4
non negative integers <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1030"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:48.75pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=65 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1030"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1030"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912063">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>and a <span
class=GramE>character </span><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1031"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:12pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=16 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1031"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1031"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912064">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1032" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:41.25pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=55 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1032"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1032"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912065">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>and <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1033" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:42pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=56 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1033"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1033"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912066">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>indicate the coordinates
of the <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1034" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:6.75pt;height:12pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=9 height=16
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1034"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1034"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912067">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->th sprinkler in row-column format (with the upper leftmost
cell having having coordinates </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>(1, 1)</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>), <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1035" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:74.25pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=99 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1035"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1035"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912068">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>is its watering time
in each direction, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1036" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:29.25pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=39 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1036"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1036"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912069">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>is its range, and
finally, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1037" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:12pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=16 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1037"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1037"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912070">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>is a character which
indicates the original direction of the sprinkler in the beginning of time 0.
The possible values of <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1038"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:12pt;height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=16 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1038"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1038"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912071">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>are </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> (for north), </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>S</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> (for south),
</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>E</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> (for east), and </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>W</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> (for west).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>The
last line of each test case consists of two integers <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1039" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:102.75pt;height:14.25pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=137 height=19
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1039"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1039"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912072">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>indicating that Khepel
would like to sleep from the start of time <i>a</i> until the end of time <i>b</i>.
Input is terminated with a test case <span class=GramE>having </span><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1040" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:56.25pt;height:12pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=75 height=16
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p1_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1040"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1040"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912073">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>The Output <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>The
output for each test case is a single integer which is the total number of
cells in which Khepel is able to sleep from the start of time <span
class=GramE><i>a</i> until</span> the end of time <i>b</i>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>100 100 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>1 1 100 1 E<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>0 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>0 0 0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>9998<o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='color:black'>
Amirkabir University of Technology - Local Contest - Round #2
</span></b><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</body>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in'><b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Problem C<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;
margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:0in;text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>3KP-BASH Project<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Mohammad:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> I cant continue. I give up!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Arash:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> Why?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Mohammad:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> <span class=GramE>cause</span> I have read the
obfuscated source-code of Unix BASH several times, and the more I read the less
I understand. Thats why I want to give up porting it to our own OS, 3KP.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Arash:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> Ok, Ok, just calm down. Let me think about it.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
 <span
class=GramE>After several minutes of thinking 
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Arash:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> Ok, why dont we write our own BASH! Trust me! We just
need a small subset of the functionalities in the BASH. So, lets write our own
version.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Mohammad:</span></b><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> No! No! Youre kidding!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Poor
Mohammad! He has a lot of tasks to do. Besides a pile of books to study for his
exams, he should also make some problems for the local programming contest of
their university. Considering these tasks, Mohammad wonders whether he is able
to accomplish this new task . . . <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>OK!
Mohammad has found a solution. In fact, he has decided to out-source the
3KP-BASH project. In other words, he would like to hire you as a professional
programmer to write 3KP-BASH for him.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>Problem Definition<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>The
BASH environment for 3KP is intended to support only eight commands. The other
functionalities are decided to be available as stand-alone executable programs
that can be run from our BASH (Mohammad and Arash have already written the
program execution codes, so you only have to add support for these eight
commands).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Before
describing the supported commands, lets have a brief review of some basic
things about 3KP operating system.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b>File System<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.75in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1;tab-stops:list .75in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>File</span></b></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>: file is a simple object in this system. Each file
has a name which is actually a string consisting of English alphabetic
characters, numeric characters, and </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>.</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> (<span
class=GramE>dot</span>) character. A filename cannot contain two consecutive </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>.</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> characters. Also, the user cannot create a file or
directory with its name equal to a single </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>.</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>. A filename
is no longer than 255 characters. Note that filenames are case-sensitive. Each
file has a size which is the amount of data in it. The maximum allowed size for
a file <span class=GramE>is </span><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:17.25pt;
 height:15pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p2_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=23 height=20
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/images/p2_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1192912130">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. A file may also have some attributes. In the first version
of our BASH, we only need to know two of them which are </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>directory</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> and </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> attributes.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.75in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1;tab-stops:list .75in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Directory:
</span></b></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>is simply a file with </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>directory</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> attribute and size of zero. In fact, a directory is
used as a logical place for keeping files. In other words, each directory may
contain an arbitrary number of files (or directories) inside it. An empty file
system is assumed to have only one directory which is called the Root
Directory.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b>Current Directory<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>At
any time, there is a single directory which is assumed to be the default
directory for programs to use. This directory is called the Current Directory.
When our BASH starts, it sets the current directory to the root directory. A
user may change the current directory during his works using the facilities supplied
by BASH.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b>File and Directory Addressing<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>As
you may know, there are many commands and programs which take a file or
directory as their input argument. So, we need to have a way to tell these
programs exactly which file or directory we would like them to perform some
operations on. There are two methods for addressing a file or directory:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.75in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2;tab-stops:list .75in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Full
path addressing: </span></b></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>In this
method, all path elements are written from the root directory with each two
consecutive elements separated by a </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>/</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> character.
For example, suppose we have a directory named </span><span style='font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>home</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
in the root directory and inside </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>home</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>, there
is another directory named </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>acm</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> which itself contains
a directory or file named </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>uva</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>. Using full-path
addressing, we should write </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>[root]/home/acm/uva</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> in
order to address </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>. For the sake of simplicity, it is decided that </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[root]</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be omitted from the above phrase thus
resulting in </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/home/acm/uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> for full-path addressing </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.75in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2;tab-stops:list .75in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span dir=LTR><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Relative
Addressing: </span></b></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Suppose that in
the above example, </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>acm</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> has two directories named </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> and </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>avu</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> and the
user has set the current directory to </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>avu</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>. Now, if
he/she wants to address </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>, in addition to full-path addressing, he has a
simpler way which is by using the string </span><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>..</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>. In other words, a directory name of </span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>..</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'></span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
indicates the parent directory of the current directory or the parent directory
of the directory which is listed in the address string exactly before its
occurrence. So, in the example above, </span><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>../..</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'></span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> is equal
to<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>/home</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> and </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>../../../home/<span
class=GramE>..<span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'></span></span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> is equal to the root directory. Theres also another
directory name </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>.</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> which means the current directory. So, again in the
example above, assuming that the current directory is </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/home/acm</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>, </span><span class=GramE><span style='font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>./</span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> is equal
to </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/home/acm/uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>. Note that the user have the choice to omit </span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>./</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> from this kind of addresses. So, </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> is exactly equal to </span><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>./</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>uva</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Now
that we know enough about the file system and addressing, we can see what the
commands are.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>Commands<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoTableGrid border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=596
 style='width:447.3pt;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:
 .5pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:34.5pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;background:#D9D9D9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:34.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:14.0pt'>Usage<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  background:#D9D9D9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:34.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:14.0pt'>Description<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;height:34.5pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:34.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> path<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:34.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></b></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> is the simplest command in our system. </span><span
  class=GramE><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></b></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> changes the current directory to </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> which is a directory addressed using either
  full-path or relative addressing methods. If </span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  does not exist, the error message </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>path not found</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  should be printed in the standard output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2;height:14.7pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>touch </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>filename<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>[-size] [-h]<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>touch</span></b></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> command is used to create or modify a file. </span><span
  class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>filename</span></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> is actually a path with its last element equal to
  the name of the file to be created. All the elements of the path except the
  last element should form a valid address to an existing directory and the
  last element should be a valid filename. If the indicated filename does not
  exist in the indicated path, a new file is created with its size equal to </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>size</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> argument of the command. If the argument is not
  given then the size of the newly created file is assumed to be equal to zero.
  Also </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-h</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> argument tells the bash to set the </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> attribute for the newly created file. In the case that
  the given filename already exists in the indicated path, the file should be
  deleted and recreated with the new arguments.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>In
  the case that the indicated path of the file to be created does not exist,
  touch command should print the error message </span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path not found</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> on the standard output. And in the case that there
  exists a directory in the indicated path with the same name as the file to be
  created, the error message </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New"'>a directory with the same name exists</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be printed on the standard output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3;height:14.7pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>mkdir </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[-h]<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Creates
  a directory with the address equal to </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>path</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> argument.
  The last element of the address is the name for the new directory. The other elements
  of the address should form a valid address and should address an existing
  directory. In the case that these elements do not meet these conditions, the
  error message </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path
  not found</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be printed in the standard
  output. Also, if a file or directory exists in the given path with the same
  name as the directory to be created, the error message </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>file or directory with the
  same name exists</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be printed on
  the standard output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Note
  that if </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-h</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> is specified as an argument, then the newly created
  directory is given the </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> attribute.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4;height:14.7pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>find </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>filename [-r] [-h]<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.7pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Searches
  for files or directories. </span><span class=GramE><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>filename</span></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be a valid address with the last element
  equal to the name of the file or directory to be searched for. The other
  elements of the address should address an existing directory which is the
  directory to be searched or else the error message </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path not found</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> is printed on the standard output. If </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-r </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>is specified then all of the directories inside the
  given address should also be searched recursively. By default, </span><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>find</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> does not search within the files or directories
  having the </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> attribute unless </span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-h </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>is
  specified as an argument. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>For
  each file or directory found with the specified name, exactly one line is printed
  in the standard output containing the full-path of the file or directory, its
  size, the word </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden
  </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>if the </span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  attribute is set for the file and the word </span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>dir</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  if the directory attribute is set for the file. All these properties should
  be separated by single space characters. The results should be sorted by
  lexicographical order of full-path addresses which means that in order to
  compare two files, the path elements of their full-path addresses are
  lexicographically compared to each other from left to right. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>In
  the case no such file or directory is found, the error message </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>file not found</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be printed on the standard output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5;height:15.5pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[path] <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[-h] [-r] <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[-s] [-S] <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[-f] [-d]<b><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></b></span><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>is a very popular command used to list the contents
  of<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>[part of] the file system. In its
  simplest form, </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> </span><span class=GramE><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>does</span></span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  not take any arguments. In this case, all of the files and directories in the
  current directory that do not have the </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  attribute are listed in a similar format to that of </span><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>find</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> command. In the case there is no such file or
  directory in the current directory, it prints the message </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[empty]</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>If
  </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>is specified as an argument and is the address of an
  existing directory, then </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New"'>ls</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> performs its
  operation on </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> instead of the current directory.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Among
  the other arguments, if </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New"'>-h </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>is specified, then
  the files and directories with </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>hidden</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>
  attribute are also shown. In the case </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>-r </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>is
  specified, </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>performs its operation on the directories within the
  original directory to be searched recursively. If </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-s </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>is specified, the results are first sorted in
  non-decreasing order by size. There, in the case there are two files having
  the same sizes, the two files should be ordered in a manner similar to </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>find</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> command. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>As
  an argument, the functionality of </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>-S</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> is
  similar to </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-s
  </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>instead of the fact that </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-S</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> sorts the files by size in non-increasing order.
  Argument </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-d </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>forces</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'> <b>ls</b> </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>to
  only show the directories in the result while</span><span style='font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> -f </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>forces</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> <b>ls</b> </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>to only show the files that do not have the
  directory attribute.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6;height:19.5pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:19.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>pwd<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:19.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  mso-bidi-language:FA'>Prints the full-path address of the current directory
  on the standard output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7;height:14.25pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>exit<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Terminates
  the session and exits BASH<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:8;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:14.25pt'>
  <td width=127 style='width:95.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:
  none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep </span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>string<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=469 style='width:351.9pt;border-top:none;border-left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:14.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep</span></b></span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> is a special command with a special usage form. In
  detail, it takes an string and searches its standard input for all
  occurrences of that string and outputs all the lines of its standard input
  that contain those occurrences on the standard output. In this special
  version of </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> in our BASH, the standard input can only be fed to
  it by the means of a technology named piping. Piping is a technology that can
  be used to attach the standard output of one command to the standard input of
  another one. In more details, all the outputs generated by the first command
  are passed to the second command as standard input. Pipes can be used in the
  form </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>command1
  | command2</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>. Executing this phrase
  causes BASH to execute command1 first and then pass its standard output to
  command2 and execute command2 respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>So,
  to feed </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> with some input, we should use pipes as stated
  above. For example, </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New"'>ls</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>
  | <b>grep</b> acm</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>  searches the
  result of </span><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></b><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'> command for any lines containing the word </span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>acm</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>At
last note that the mandatory arguments of all the commands should be passed
with the specified order but the optional arguments can be passed in any order.
Any of the above commands if not used according to the usage form specified,
produce the error message </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>bad usage</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt'> on the standard
output e.g. if a command is passed extra or redundant arguments. Also, if a
command is entered which is not among the above commands, the error message </span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>no such command</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> should be printed on the standard output. Note that
these two error messages cannot be piped to </span><b><span style='font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Now
that you exactly know how our BASH works, in order to warm-up yourself for
implementing the real BASH, just write a program that simulates a chain of
commands and produces outputs. It is guaranteed that none of the commands have
two (or more) type of errors simultaneously.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>You
are advised to read the sample input/output carefully to see how these commands
work.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>The Input <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>Input
consists of several work sessions. Each session consists of several lines, each
containing a command to be executed. Length of a line containing a command is
no more than 2048 characters. Also, there may be arbitrary number of space
characters before and after the command and between its arguments. Each session is
terminated with an </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>exit</span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'> command. Input is terminated by end-of-file.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>You
must assume that in the beginning of each session, the default directory is the
root directory and the file system is empty. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><b>The Output</b> </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>For each session, your
program should produce the output of each command appearing on the input.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>pwd</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> acm<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>mkdir</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> ./acm<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> ./acm<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> acm<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>pwd</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>touch</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> acm -h -1000<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd ..</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>cd</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> /<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>grep</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> -r -s<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ls</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> -r -h<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>find</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> acm -h -r | grep
&quot;1000&quot;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>exit</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b>Sample<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Output</b></span><b><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>path</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> not found<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>[<span class=GramE>empty</span>]<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/acm<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>bad</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> usage<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/acm 0 dir<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/acm 0 dir<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/acm/acm 1000 hidden<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>/acm/acm 1000 hidden<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

</div>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='color:black'>
Amirkabir University of Technology - Local Contest - Round #2
</span></b><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
o\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
.shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
</style>
<![endif]-->
<title>Problem D</title>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="PlaceType"/>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="PlaceName"/>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="place"/>

<xml><o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
