<body lang=EN-US link="#009999" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem <span class=GramE>A</span></span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Another New Function </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'>4<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> Second</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>The depth of phi value of a number is denoted by the number of steps
required before it reaches 1. An example will make it very clear.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>&#934;(</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>13)=12 ......
step 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>&#934;(</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>12)=4 ......
step 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>&#934;(</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>4)=2 ......
step 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>&#934;(</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>2)=1 ......
step 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>So the depth
of <span class=GramE>phi(</span>13) is 4. We name this function as <span
class=SpellE>depthphi</span>. So we can write <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE>depthphi</span></span><span class=GramE>(</span>13)=4. The sum of <span
class=SpellE>depthphi</span> function (SODF) takes two integers as parameter
and its definition is given below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
style='position:relative;top:14.0pt;mso-text-raise:-14.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:213pt;
 height:39.6pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=284 height=53
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1200998521">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'>Given the value of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n</b> your job is to find the value of <span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>SODF(</b></span><span class=SpellE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m,n</b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>)</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:
16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of the input file
contains an integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N (0&lt;N&lt;2001) </b>which
indicates how many sets of inputs are there. Each of the next <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> lines contains two <span class=GramE>integers</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n (2 &le; m &le; n &le; 2000000)</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each line
of input produce one line of output. This line contains an integer <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>, which actually denotes the value of <span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>SODF(</b></span><span
class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m,n</b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>)</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                               </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=384 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>100000 200000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=386 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>22<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1495105<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=3 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Problem
setter: Shahriar Manzoor, EPS<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Special
Thanks: Derek <span class=SpellE>Kisman</span>, EPS<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>The following paragraph is extracted from <span
class=SpellE>Mathworld</span> to inform you about phi function.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:8.0pt;font-family:Verdana'>The <span
class=SpellE>totient</span> function <!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1026"
 type="#_x0000_t75" alt="phi(n)" style='width:19.8pt;height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline1.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=26 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt="phi(n)" class=inlineformula border=0 v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>or phi(n), also called Euler's <span
class=SpellE>totient</span> function, is defined as the number of <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/PositiveInteger.html">positive integers</a> <!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="&lt;=n" style='width:18pt;height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline2.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img border=0 width=24 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt="&lt;=n" class=inlineformula v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]>that
are <a href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/RelativelyPrime.html">relatively
prime</a> to (i.e., do not contain any factor in common with) <!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1028" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="n" style='width:5.4pt;height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline3.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img border=0 width=7 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt=n class=inlineformula v:shapes="_x0000_i1028"><![endif]>,
where 1 is counted as being <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/RelativelyPrime.html">relatively prime</a>
to all numbers. Since a number less than or equal to and <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/RelativelyPrime.html">relatively prime</a>
to a given number is called a <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Totative.html"><span class=SpellE>totative</span></a>,
the <span class=SpellE>totient</span> function <!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1029" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="phi(n)" style='width:19.8pt;
 height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline4.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img border=0 width=26 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt="phi(n)" class=inlineformula v:shapes="_x0000_i1029"><![endif]>can
be simply defined as the number of <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Totative.html"><span class=SpellE>totatives</span></a>
of <!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1030" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="n"
 style='width:5.4pt;height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline5.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img border=0 width=7 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt=n class=inlineformula v:shapes="_x0000_i1030"><![endif]>.
For example, there are eight <a
href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Totative.html"><span class=SpellE>totatives</span></a>
of 24 (1, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, and 23), <span class=GramE>so </span><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1031" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="phi(24)==8" style='width:44.4pt;
 height:11.4pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/images/equations/TotientFunction/inline6.gif"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img border=0 width=59 height=15
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/a_files/image001.wmz"  alt="phi(24)==8" class=inlineformula v:shapes="_x0000_i1031"><![endif]>.
The <span class=SpellE>totient</span> function is implemented in <i><a
href="http://www.wolfram.com/products/mathematica/"><span class=SpellE>Mathematica</span></a></i>
as </span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><a
href="http://documents.wolfram.com/mathematica/functions/EulerPhi"><span
class=SpellE>EulerPhi</span></a></span><span style='font-size:8.0pt;font-family:
Verdana'>[<i>n</i>]. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem B</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Region</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:225.6pt;
 height:226.8pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/p10991.gif"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=301 height=302
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/p10991.gif"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>From above figure, it is clear that <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>C1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C2</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C3</b> circles are touching each other. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Consider,</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b>C1</b>
circle have <b>R1</b> radius.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b>C2</b>
circle have <b>R2</b> radius.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b>C3</b>
circle have <b>R3</b> radius.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Write a program that will calculate the area of shaded
region <b><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>G</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'>The first line will contain an integer</span><span lang=EN
style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'> </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>k (1 </span>&#8804; k &#8804;
1000)</b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Tahoma'>
</span></b><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>which is the number of
cases to solve. Each of the following </span><span lang=EN style='font-size:
14.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>k</span><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'> Lines will contain three </span>floating point number <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>R1</b><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN'> <b><span lang=EN>(1 </span></b></span><b>&#8804;
R1 &#8804; 1000)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>,</span><span
style='font-family:Verdana;mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'> </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R2</b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'> <span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>(1
</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&#8804; R2 &#8804; 1000)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> and </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>R3 </b><b><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>(1 </span>&#8804;
R3 &#8804; 1000)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Output
</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input, generate
one line of output containing the area of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>G</b>
<span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>rounded to six decimal digits after
the decimal point. Floating-point errors will be ignored by special judge
program.</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.76%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5.70 1.00 7.89<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>478.61 759.84 28.36<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.24%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1.224323<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2361.005761<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

setter: <st1:State w:st="on"><st1:place w:st="on">Md.</st1:place></st1:State>

<meta content="  name=Keywords>
<meta content="  name=Description>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="6146"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>The</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
24.0pt;font-family:Arial'> Ghost of Programmers</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><b><i><span
style='color:black'>Year 2500.</span></i></b></span><b><i><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Head of the CSE department
of IIUC Dhaka Campus Mr. <span class=SpellE>Shamsul</span> <span class=SpellE>Alam</span>
is telling a story to the new students, &quot;This is the oldest building of
IIUC-Dhaka Campus. We never go into this building.&quot; Students ask him why.
He says. &quot;It is the story of 21st century. Our authority always used to
arrange programming contests in this building and for this purpose all of the <span
class=SpellE>problemsetters</span> of that time used to come here. All of them
liked this place very much. But the main problem is that even after their death
their ghosts began to come here.&quot; Students ask &quot;How many ghosts are
there, sir?<span class=GramE>&quot;.</span> &quot;No body knows their number.
But I can tell the name of main nine ghosts.&quot;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>0. The ghost of <span
class=SpellE>Tanveer</span> <span class=SpellE>Ahsan</span>  It comes in every
2 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>1. The ghost of Shahriar
Manzoor - It comes in every 5 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>2. The ghost of Adrian <span
class=SpellE>Kugel</span> - It comes in every 7 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>3. The ghost of Anton <span
class=SpellE>Maydell</span> - It comes in every 11 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>4. The ghost of Derek <span
class=SpellE>Kisman</span> - It comes in every 15 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>5. The ghost of <span
class=SpellE>Rezaul</span> <span class=SpellE>Alam</span> <span class=SpellE>Chowdhury</span>
- It comes in every 20 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>6. The ghost of Jimmy <span
class=SpellE>Mardell</span> - It comes in every 28 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>7. The ghost of <span
class=SpellE>Monirul</span> Hasan - It comes in every 36 year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE><span
style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>and</span></span><span
style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>
finally the second most frequent visitor<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>8. The ghost of K. M. <span
class=SpellE>Iftekhar</span> - It comes in every leap year<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Students again ask which
ghost came first. His reply was, &quot;All the ghost first came at the year
2148&quot;.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Now your task is to write
a program which can answer that which ghost/ghosts will come for a given year.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='color:black;
mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<h4><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText>There are will be at most <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>250</b> lines of data in the input file each containing a positive
integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Y</b>. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Y</b> has less than fifty digits. Input is terminated by a line which
contains a zero.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><br style='mso-special-character:
line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none'>For
each <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Y</b>, output will contain the year
itself on the first line followed by the name of the ghosts which will come on
that year in the form &quot;Ghost of G!!!&quot; (<span class=GramE>without</span>
quotes). G should be replaced with the name of the ghost. If more than one
ghost come then follow the order of names as given in the problem statement. <span
class=GramE>If for a given year no ghost from the given names will come then
print &quot;No ghost will come in this year&quot;(without quotes).</span> Print
a blank line between two consecutive <span class=GramE>output</span>.<b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                               </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width="48%" valign=top style='width:48.76%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2500<br>
  3000<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span></b><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51%" valign=top style='width:51.24%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2500<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Ghost of <span
  class=SpellE>Tanveer</span> <span class=SpellE>Ahsan</span>!!!<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Ghost of Anton <span
  class=SpellE>Maydell</span>!!!<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3000<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoBodyText><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Ghost of <span
  class=SpellE>Tanveer</span> <span class=SpellE>Ahsan</span>!!!<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Problem setter: K. M. <span class=SpellE>Iftekhar</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:419.15pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Moderator: Shahriar Manzoor, EPS</b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>NB: Leap year is a year that is
divisible by 4 and not divisible by 100. But the years that are divisible by
400 are also leap year. For example 2004, 2000 is a <span class=SpellE>leapyear</span>
but 1973, 1700 is not <span class=SpellE>leapyear</span>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>This problem will be set by the
Ghost of K. M. <span class=SpellE>Iftekhar</span> from the balcony of the
oldest building of IIUC Dhaka Campus.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>This problem will be
significantly moderated by Shahriar Manzoor (<st1:City w:st="on">Southeast
 University</st1:City>, <st1:country-region w:st="on">Bangladesh</st1:country-region>)
to make it more interesting, when he will first meet the <span class=SpellE>problemsetter</span>
after the story being told by the head of <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:City w:st="on">IIUC</st1:City>
 <st1:State w:st="on">DC</st1:State></st1:place> in 2500 AD.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:65.2pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=SV style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span lang=SV style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=SV style='font-size:
20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Ignoring Digits</span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=SV style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
lang=SV style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=SV><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>When representing a number in decimal format,
we need the ten digits '0' to '9'. If we are only allowed to use a subset of
the ten decimal digits, there is only a limited number of numbers we can
represent. If, for example, we only can use the digits '1' and '2', the numbers
11 and 12 can be represented, but the number 13 can not. If we scan the
multiples of 13: 13, 26, 39, 52, 65, 78, 91, 104, 117, 130, 143, 156, 169, 182,
195, 208, 221, etc., we see that 221 is the smallest multiple of 13 that can be
represented using only the digits '1' and '2'. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:
EN-US'>In this problem you are asked to give the smallest multiple of a certain
number that can be represented using a given subset of the decimal digits. This
multiple can be the number itself, but it has to be greater than zero. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'>The input consists of several cases, each on a
line by itself. Each line has two numbers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>F</b>
and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>F</b> is a number composed of the digits you are allowed to use in the
representation. It has a minimum of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b>
and a maximum of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>10</b> unique digits in
descending order. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> is the number
for which you are to find the multiple. It is greater than zero, but smaller
than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>100000</b>.<br>
A line with two zeros ends the input and should not be processed. </h5>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span lang=SV style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<h4 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For every
case in the input, one line containing the smallest multiple of </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>N</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> that can be represented using
the digits in </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>F</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>. If such a multiple of </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>N</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> doesn't exist, print the word </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>&quot;impossible&quot;
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>(without the quotes). Never
print leading zeros. </span><span lang=SV style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b><span
lang=SV style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b><span
lang=SV style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                                
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width="50%" valign=top style='width:50.58%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>1 11<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>21 12<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>21 13<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

  12345<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US'>97531 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width="49%" valign=top style='width:49.42%;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Simple Addition</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=SV>&nbsp;</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'>Lets define a simple recursive
function F (n), where </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;text-indent:.5in'><span
style='position:relative;top:25.0pt;mso-text-raise:-25.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:157.2pt;
 height:55.8pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/e_files/image005.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=210 height=74
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/e_files/image005.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1200998493">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'>Lets define another function S (p,
q), </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;text-indent:.5in'><span
style='position:relative;top:15.0pt;mso-text-raise:-15.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:97.8pt;height:39pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/e_files/image005.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=130 height=52
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/e_files/image005.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></span><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1200998494">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'>In this problem you have to
Calculate <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S (p, q)</b> on given value
of<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p
</b>and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>q.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify'>The input file
contains several lines of inputs. Each line contains two non negative integers <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p </b>and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>q</b> <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(p &lt;= q)</b> separated
by a single space. <span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p</b></span>
and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>q</b> will fit in 32 bit signed
integer. In put is terminated by a line which contains two negative integers.
This line should not be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify'>For each set of
input print a single line of the value of <span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S(</b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>p, q)</b>. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>Sample
Input <span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                         </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="93%"
 style='width:93.42%;margin-left:.45in;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;

  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal>46</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>48</p>

10995||||||false||||||
<title>Problem A: Educational journey</title>

<h2>Problem A: Educational journey </h2>

<img src=p10995.jpg align=right hspace=10 vspace =10>

The University of Calgary team qualified for the 28th ACM
International Collegiate Programming Contest World Finals in Prague,
Czech Republic.  Just by using the initials of team members they
got a very cunning team name: <b>ACM</b> (<b>A</b>lecs,
<b>C</b>elly and <b>M</b>onny).  In order to prepare for the
contest, they have decided to travel to Edmonton to learn
the tricks of trade from <b>D</b>ilbert, Alberta-wide famous
top-coder.
<p>
Due to a horrible miscommunication which is as welcome as a plague
among such teams,
<b>A</b>, <b>C</b> and <b>M</b> drive from Calgary to Edmonton in
separate cars.  To make things worse, there was also a
miscommunication with <b>D</b>, who being always so helpful, decides
to go to Calgary in order to save the team a trip to the far, freezing
North.  All this happens on the same day and each car travels at a
constant (but not necessarily the same) speed on the famous Alberta #2.
<p>
<b>A</b> passed <b>C</b> and <b>M</b> at time <em>t1</em> and
<em>t2</em>, respectively, and met D at time <em>t3</em>.
<b>D</b> met <b>C</b> and <b>M</b> at times <em>t4</em> and
<em>t5</em>, respectively.  The question is: at what time
time did <b>C</b> pass <b>M</b>?
<p>
The input is a sequence of lines, each containing times <em>t1</em>,
<em>t2</em>, <em>t3</em>, <em>t4</em> and <em>t5</em>, separated by
white space. All times are distinct and given in increasing order.
Each time is given in the hh:mm:ss format on the 24-hour clock.
A line containing -1 terminates the input.
<p>
For each line of input produce one line of output giving the time when 
<b>C</b> passed <b>M</b> in the same format as input, rounding the
seconds in the standard way.
<p>
<h3>Sample input</h3>
<pre>
10:00:00 11:00:00 12:00:00 13:00:00 14:00:00
10:20:00 10:58:00 14:32:00 14:59:00 16:00:00
10:20:00 12:58:00 14:32:00 14:59:00 16:00:00
08:00:00 09:00:00 10:00:00 12:00:00 14:00:00
-1
</pre>

<h3>Output for sample input</h3>
<pre>
12:00:00
11:16:54
13:37:32
10:40:00
</pre>

<hr>

<em>Folklore, adapted by P. Rudnicki</em>

______________________________________________________
10996||||||false||||||
<img align=right src=p10996.gif><h2>Problem B: Go</h2>
Go is played on a square board with an odd number of
vertical and horizontal lines.  The usual board
sizes are 9x9, 13x13 and 19x19.  But we'll assume
the size in <i>n</i>x<i>n</i> for 3 &le; n &le; 19.
<p>
Black and White alternately play stones on the 
intersection between two lines.  Black starts.  At
any time one player may pass - not play a stone -
but if both players pass the game ends.  We'll
denote playing a stone by P(x,y) where P is either
B (for Black) or W (for White) and (1-n)/2 &le; x,y &le (n-1)/2
gives the grid position of the stone to be played.
The centre intersection of the board has coordinates (0,0).
<p>
The rules of Go are reasonably straightforward, but the
nuances of strategy make it an extremely challenging game.
You are to use the following rules.
<ul>
<li>Black plays first.
<li>Black and White alternate; at each turn a player may place
a stone or may pass.  The game ends when Black and White pass
consecutively.
<li>A stone may be played only on an unoccupied intersection.
<li>If one player P places a stone so that his or her stones
(along with the edge of the board) completely surround a
connected area occupied by stones belonging to the other
player, Q, Q's stones are said to be captured and removed
from the board.  More precisely, two intersections are
connected if they are horizontally or vertically
(but not diagonally) adjacent.  Stones in an area
are completely surrounded if no stone is
connected with a vacant intersection.
<li> If P places a stone that causes
Q's stones to be captured, P's stone is
not captured.
<li>A connected area surrounded by P's stones which
contains none of Q's stones is said to be <i>owned</i>
by P.
<li>The score for player P is the number of
vacant intersections owned by P in the final board
configuration plus the number of Q's stones captured by P
at any time during the game.
</ul>
The input consists of several test cases.  Each
test case begins with a line containing <i>n</i>
- the size of the board - and <i>m</i> - the
number of stones placed in the game.  <i>m</i> lines
follow, each giving a placement in the format above.
Note that <i>m</i> counts only stone placements -
passes may result in two consecutive placements
by the same player.
You may assume that each move is legal. 
A line
containing 0 0 follows the last test case.
<p>
For each test case, output a line with two
numbers:  Black's score followed by White's score.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
7 6
B(-2,-2)
W(2,2)
B(-2,-3)
W(2,3)
B(-3,-2)
W(3,2)
7 6
B(-2,-3)
W(-3,-3)
B(-2,-2)
W(3,2)
B(-3,-2)
W(2,3)
0 0
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
1 1
2 1
</pre>
<hr>
<i>Gordon V. Cormack</i>

______________________________________________________
10997||||||false||||||
<html><head><title>Medals</title></head>
	<body>
		<h2>Problem C: Medals</h2>


<img src=p10997.jpg vspace=20 hspace=20 align=right>

		At the Olympic Games, countries are ranked according to the number of medals
		their athletes won. However, there is more than one possible way of ranking
		countries by their medals. In Europe, for example, countries are first ranked
		by the number of gold medals their athletes won. Ties are broken by looking
		at silver medals, and then at bronze medals. In Canada, however, because
		Canadian athletes do not win very many gold medals, countries are ranked by
		the overall number of medals won, giving the same weight to gold, silver, and
		bronze medals.
		<br><br>
		In general, a ranking scheme can be thought of as a vector of positive weights.
		This vector is multiplied with the vector of medals won by each country, and
		the scalar product of the two vectors defines the score of the respective country,
		which is then used to produce the ranking. In this general scheme, the European
		ranking technique corresponds to the weight vector <i>(10<sup>20</sup>, 10<sup>10</sup>, 1)</i>,
		whereas the Canadian method corresponds to the vector <i>(1, 1, 1)</i>.
		<br><br>
		In this problem, you will only need to consider weight vectors of the form
		<i>(1/n<sup>j</sup>, 1/n<sup>k</sup>, 1/n<sup>l</sup>)</i>, where <i>n</i> is the
		total number of medals won by all athletes in the Olympic Games, and
		<i>j</i>, <i>k</i>, and <i>l</i> are integers.
		<br><br>
		Given a list of countries and the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won by each
		country, print the line
		<blockquote>
			<tt>Canada wins!</tt>
		</blockquote>
		if there is a weight vector of the above form such that Canada ranks first according to
		the ranking scheme defined by that vector. Print the line
		<blockquote>
			<tt>Canada cannot win.</tt>
		</blockquote>
		if no such vector exists.
		<br><br>
		The input contains multiple test cases. Each test case starts with an integer <i>c</i>,
		the number of countries to follow. Each of the following <i>c</i> lines contains the name
		of a country and three integers <i>g</i>, <i>s</i>, and <i>b</i> &ndash; the number of
		gold, silver, and bronze medals won by the country. The last test case has <i>c = 0</i>
		and must not be processed. It is guaranteed that each test case contains at most 20
		different countries and that the total number of medals smaller than 100. Country names
		do not contain whitespace characters.
		<br><br>
		<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>2
Canada 3 2 1
USA 1 2 3
2
USA 2 2 2
Canada 1 1 1
0</pre>
		<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>Canada wins!
Canada cannot win.</pre>
<br>
<hr><i>Stefan B&uuml;ttcher</i></body></html>



______________________________________________________
10998||||||false||||||
<title>Problem D: Flipping colors</title>

<h2>Problem D: Flipping colors</h2>

<img src=p10998.jpg vspace=20 hspace=20 align=right>

A rectangle with sides parallel to the x-y axes and its left-lower corner
at (0,&nbsp;0) is being painted.  The rectangle may be thought of
as a flat-screen display
with almost infinite resolution; initially the entire rectangle is
black.  Two numbers are given 0 < <b>h</b>, <b>v</b> < 1 and then
<ul>
<li> A vertical
line is drawn dividing the horizontal sides of the rectangle in
proportion
<b>h</b>:1-<b>h</b> from the left.  
<li> A horizontal line is drawn
dividing the vertical sides of the rectangles in proportion
<b>v</b>:1-<b>v</b> from the bottom up.  
<li>These two lines divide the
rectangle into four smaller rectangles.  
<li>The upper left and the
lower right sub-rectangles remain intact.  
<li>The color
of the other two rectangles is flipped (from black to white or from
white to black) and now each of them is subject to the operation
just performed on the bigger rectangle.  
<li> This process continues (in principle) forever.
</ul>

Given a point in the original rectangle but not on the boundary of any
rectangle that turns up in the process of painting, determine the color
of the point.
<p>
Input contains multiple cases.  The first line of each case 
contains 4 numbers, the length of the rectangle <b>H</b>, the height of the
rectangle <b>V</b> and then the numbers <b>h</b> and <b>v</b>.  The next
line contains one integer number <b>n</b>, the number of points to consider.
The following <b>n</b> lines contain two numbers each, the <b>x</b> and
the <b>y</b> coordinate of a point.
<p>
Organize your output as shown in the sample.  For each point from input
print the color of the point.

<h3>Sample input</h3>
<pre>
81 32 0.333333333333 0.5
6
16 30
16 25
16 12.0001
16 11.9999
16 7.987654321
16 7.0123456789
10 10 0.123456789 0.987654321
2
0.432 0.9876
9.432 0.9876
0 0 0 0
</pre>


<h3>Output for sample input</h3>
<pre>
Case 1:
black
black
white
black
white
white
Case 2:
white
black
</pre>

<hr>

<em>Piotr Rudnicki</em>

______________________________________________________
10999||||||false||||||
<html>
<head>
</head>
<title>
Crabbles
</title>
<body>
<h2>Problem E: Crabbles</h2>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/109/p10999.jpg"  align="right"/>
<p>
Jennifer is practicing for a Crabbles tournament. She pulls out a
handful of Crabbles tiles out of a bag, and tries to form the word with
the highest possible score. Each tile contains a letter (used to form
the word) and a number (its score value). She can use each tile at most
once in her word, and she is not required to use every tile. The word
that she forms must appear in her dictionary. Her score
is the sum of the values of the tiles used in the word.
</p>
<p>
Note that in Crabble, different tiles with the same letter
may have different score values.
</p>
<p>
To check her work, Jennifer would like a program to tell her the maximum
score possible for the set of tiles. Your task is to write this program.
</p>

<h4>Input Specification</h4>
The first line contains an integer 1 &le; N &le; 100,000
indicating the number of words in the dictionary. N lines follow,
with one dictionary word on each line. Each dictionary word consists
of only lowercase letters. The following line contains an
integer 1 &le; M &le; 1000 indicating the number of Crabbles hands
Jennifer wants to play. M hands follow. Each hand begins with
a line containing an integer 1 &le; P &le; 10 indicating the
number of tiles in the hand. This is followed by P lines, one
for each tile. Each of these lines consists of a lowercase letter
(the letter on the tile), a space, and an integer 0 &le; V &le; 10
(the value of the tile).

<h4>Output Specification</h4>
For each hand in the input, output a line containing the maximum score
possible with that hand.

<h4>Sample Input</h4>
<pre>
2
abcd
hgfe
1
10
a 1
b 2
c 3
d 4
e 5
f 6
g 7
h 8
i 9
j 10
</pre>
<h4>Sample Output</h4>
<pre>
26
</pre>
<hr>
<i>Ond&#345;ej Lhot&aacute;k, Jennifer Lhot&aacute;k</i>
</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11000||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds -->
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Problem A</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">Problem A: Bee</A></FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">The Problem</A></FONT></H2>
<P>In Africa there is a very special species of bee. Every year, the female bees of such species give birth to one male bee, while the male bees give birth to one male bee and one female bee, and then they die!
<p>Now scientists have accidentally found one "magical female bee" of such special species to the effect that she is immortal, but still able to give birth once a year as all the other female bees. The scientists would like to know how many bees there will be after N years. Please write a program that helps them find the number of male bees and the total number of all bees after N years.
<p>

</U></U><H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">The Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
Each line of input contains an integer N (&ge; 0). Input ends with a case where N = -1. (This case should NOT be processed.)

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">The Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
Each line of output should have two numbers, the first one being the number of male bees after N years, and the second one being the total number of bees after N years. (The two numbers will not exceed 2<sup>32</sup>.)
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001005000000000000000">Sample Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
1
3
-1
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001006000000000000000">Sample Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
1 2
4 7
</PRE>
<hr>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11001||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<TITLE>Problem B</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">Problem B: Necklace</A></FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">The Problem</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The people of a certain tribe produce circular ceramic discs with equal diameter by some rare clay. A necklace is formed by connecting one or more discs. The figure below shows a necklace made with 4 discs. Its length is 4 times the diameter of each disc.
<p><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11001a.gif"  WIDTH=241 HEIGHT=53 BORDER=0 ALT=" >
<p>The thickness of each disc is fixed. The diameter D and the volume of clay used V has the following relationship:
<br><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11001a.gif"  WIDTH=184 HEIGHT=53 BORDER=0 ALT=" >
<br>where V<sub>0</sub> is the volume consumed in the baking process, in the same unit of V. When V &le; V<sub>0</sub>, no ceramic discs can be made.
As an example, let V<sub>total</sub> = 10, V<sub>0</sub> = 1. If we use it to make 1 disc, V = V<sub>total</sub>= 10, D = 0.9. If we divide the clay into 2 parts, the volume of each part V = V<sub>total</sub>/2 = 5, and diameter of each disc formed is <IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11001a.gif"  WIDTH=131 HEIGHT=24 BORDER=0 ALT=" >
, thus the length of necklace formed this way is 1.2.
<p>As per the above example, it is obvious that the lengths of necklaces differ as the number of discs made changes. Please write a program that computes the number of discs one should make so that the necklace formed is the longest.
</U></U><H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">The Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>Each line of input contains two numbers, V<sub>total</sub> (0 &lt; V<sub>total</sub> &le; 60000) and V<sub>0</sub> (0 &lt; V<sub>0</sub> &le; 600), as defined above.
Input ends with a case where V<sub>total</sub> = V<sub>0</sub> = 0.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">The Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>Each line of output should give the number of discs one should make so that the necklace formed is the longest. If this number is not unique, or no necklaces can be formed at all, output 0 instead.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001005000000000000000">Sample Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
10 1
10 2
0 0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001006000000000000000">Sample Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
5
0
</PRE>
<hr>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11002||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<TITLE>Problem C</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">Problem C: Towards Zero</A></FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">The Problem</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
Have you ever heard of this game? The player jumps in a special game board under certain rules, so that the numbers he jumps on, after being linked up by plus or minus signs, get closest to zero.
<p>The game board looks like the one shown in Figure 1.1. Its size is determined by the number of squares in the middle row N. (Figure 1.1 is an example where N = 4.)
The player starts at the bottom-most square, then jumps in any of the directions shown in Figure 1.2. The game ends when the player reaches the topmost square. During the game, the player cannot jump out of the game board.
Finally we write down the 2N-1 numbers in order, then insert plus or minus signs between each pair of adjoining numbers such that the result is closest to zero.
<p>Let us look at the game board in Figure 1.1 as a example. We should get: 7+8+(-5)+(-2)-5-1-2=0, 7+10+(-7)-6+(-3)-3+2=0, 7+10+(-5)-10-5+1+2=0, or 7+10+(-5)+(-2)-5-3-2=0.
<p>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11002a.jpg"  WIDTH=140 HEIGHT=280 BORDER=0 ALT=" >
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11002a.jpg"  WIDTH=89 HEIGHT=125 BORDER=0 ALT=" >
</U></U><H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">The Input</A></FONT></H2>
<p>The first line of input contains N (1 &le; N &le; 30). The following 2N-1 lines give the numbers in the squares in the game board. The j-th number in the (i+1)-th line corresponds to the j-th number in the i-th row of the game board. (The numbers are all &ge; -50 and &le; 50.)
<p>Input contains multiple test cases, and it ends with a case where N = 0.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">The Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>For each case, your output should print the absolute value of the result you get for each game board.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001005000000000000000">Sample Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
4
2
3 1
-3 5 7
6 10 -2 20
-7 -5 -8
10 8
7 
0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001006000000000000000">Sample Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
0
</PRE>
<hr>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11003||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<TITLE>Problem E</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">Problem E: Boxes</A></FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">The Problem</A></FONT></H2>
<P>We have some boxes numbered 1 to N. The dimensions of all boxes are identical. Now we have to stack up some of the boxes, subject to the following constraints:
<p>
<OL>
	<LI>One cannot put more than one boxes directly upon a box;
	<LI>Boxes with lower serial numbers are not to be put upon one with a higher number;
	<LI>The weight and maximum load for each box are given. The total weight of all boxes upon a box should not exceed its maximum load.
</OL>
<p>Please write a program that finds the maximum number of boxes that can be stacked up according to the above constraints.
</U></U><H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">The Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The first line of each set of input is an integer N (1 &le; N &le; 1000). This is followed by N lines, each with two integers, both &le; 3000, representing the weight and maximum load of each box respectively.
<p>Input ends with a case where N = 0.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">The Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>Each line of your output should give the number of boxes that can be stacked up.
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001005000000000000000">Sample Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
5
19 15
7 13
5 7
6 8
1 2
0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001006000000000000000">Sample Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
4
</PRE>
<hr>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
