<body lang=EN-US link="#009999" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Cosmic Cabbages </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b>S<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>tandard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<div align=right>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=3 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Arial;
  color:windowtext'>CABBAGE</span></b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  Arial;color:windowtext'>, n.<br>
  <i>A familiar kitchen-garden vegetable about<br>
  as large and wise as a man's head.</i> <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal align=right style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
auto;text-align:right'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
color:windowtext'>Ambrose Bierce</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:windowtext'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Scientists
from the planet <span class=SpellE>Zeelich</span> have figured out a way to
grow cabbages in space. They have constructed a huge 3-dimensional steel grid
upon which they plant said cabbages. Each cabbage is attached to a corner in
the grid, where 6 steel cables meet and is assigned Cartesian coordinates. A
cosmic ant wants to crawl from cabbage X to cabbage Y along the cables that
make the grid. The cosmic ant always chooses the shortest possible path along
the grid lines while going from cabbage X to cabbage Y. This distance is called
the cosmic distance between two cabbages. Given a collection of cabbages what
is the maximum distance between any two of the cabbages? <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:
16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of input gives the
number of cases, <b>N (0&lt;N&lt;21)</b>. <b>N</b> test cases follow. Each one
starts with a line containing <b>n</b> <NBSP>(2&lt;=<b>n</b>&lt;=10<sup>5</sup>)</NBSP>.
The next <b>n</b> lines will each give the 3-dimensional coordinates of a
cosmic cabbage (integers in the range <NBSP>[-10<sup>8</sup>, 10<sup>8</sup>]</NBSP>).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test
case, output one line containing &quot;Case #<b>x</b>:&quot; followed by the
largest cosmic distance between cabbages X and Y, out of all possible choices
of X and Y.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                               </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=399 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}
p.preformatted, li.preformatted, div.preformatted
	{mso-style-name:preformatted;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	layout-grid-mode:char;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
span.StyleArial16pt
	{mso-style-name:"Style Arial 16 pt";
	mso-ansi-font-size:16.0pt;
	font-family:Arial;
	mso-ascii-font-family:Arial;
	mso-hansi-font-family:Arial;
	mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}

	{mso-style-name:" ;
	mso-spl-e:yes;}

</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}

<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="8194"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem B</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Get Straight</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input</span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>It is amazing how many different games can be
played with a simple deck of playing cards. In this problem you are playing the
game 'Get Straight' in your local casino and you will write a program that
calculates the optimal strategy for it. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>A standard deck consists of 52 playing cards,
each having a value and a suit. Possible values are: Ace, Two, Three, Four,
Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Nine, Ten, Jack, Queen and King; possible suits are:
Spades, Hearts, Diamonds and Clubs. In this problem we'll use one character
abbreviations for values (A, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, T, J, Q and K) and suits
(S, H, D and C), so we can identify each playing card with a two-character
string <span class=SpellE>value+suit</span> (AH means Ace of Hearts, 7S means
Seven of Spades). </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>In the game of Get Straight we are only concerned
with the value of the cards, and more specifically with getting runs of
consecutive cards. Cards that are listed next to each other in the above list
are considered consecutive, but also a King and an Ace are considered
consecutive. So <span class=GramE>both 7</span>, 8, 9, T and Q, K, A, 2 are
considered runs of four cards (<span class=SpellE>independend</span> of the
suits of the individual cards). </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>You start the game by paying one dollar (or euro,
yen, taka, whatever) to the dealer, who gives you 5 cards at random. Now you
can either stay (do nothing) or exchange one of your cards. If you exchange,
you discard the selected card by placing it face down in front of the dealer
and pay another dollar. The dealer gives you one of the 47 remaining cards at
random so you have 5 cards again. Now you order your cards to form one or more
runs and form a so called combination. If a combination is winning, the dealer
pays you a certain amount. Possible combinations are: </p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=3 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;border:outset 1.5pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Name<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Runs<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Payment<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Straight</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>run of 5</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>100</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Invite-the-<span class=SpellE>Neighbours</span></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>run of 4</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>10</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Bed-and-Breakfast</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>run of 3 + run of 2</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>5</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=SpellE>Menage-a-Trois</span></p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Run of 3</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>3</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Double Dutch</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Run of 2 + run of 2</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Dutch</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Run of 2</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Dummy</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>no runs</p>
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Only the highest possible combination pays, so if
you have KS, AH, 2S, 7D and 8D, you can form a Bed-and-Breakfast, a <span
class=SpellE>Menage-a-Trois</span>, a Double Dutch , a Dutch or a Dummy, but
only the Bed-and-Breakfast pays you 5 dollars. A run consists of consecutive
cards of different values, so 6S, 6H, <span class=GramE>7S,</span> 8D and 8H
contains a run of 3, not a run of 5, and is evaluated as a <span class=SpellE>Menage-a-Trois</span>.
However, 6S, 6H, 7S, 7D and 8H, contain both a run of 3 and a separate run of
2, and is <span class=SpellE>therefor</span> evaluated as a Bed-and-Breakfast. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given an initial deal of five cards, your program
has to decide the best strategy: either stay or exchange one of your cards. The
best strategy is the strategy that gives you the highest expected earning. An
example:<br>
If you initially have 2H, 3S, 5D, 6C and TC, your highest combination is Double
Dutch, which earns you nothing (you <span class=SpellE>payed</span> one dollar
and you get one back). If you decide to exchange the Ten of Clubs, you have</p>

<p>- <span class=GramE>a</span> 4/47 chance of getting a Straight;<br>
- a 8/47 chance of getting a Bed-and-Breakfast;<br>
- a 35/47 chance of being stuck with your Double Dutch.</p>

<p>This gives you an expected earning of: 4/47 * 100 + 8/47 * 5 + 35/47 * 1 - 2
= 381/47 = 8.11 dollar, so exchanging the Ten of Clubs is a better strategy
then staying with your initial cards. </p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input consists of about 1000
lines, each containing one initial deal of five cards. The cards are printed in
random order in the two-character format defined above, with one space
separating them. There are no leading or trailing spaces, so each line is exactly
14 characters long. Input is terminated by a line which contains a single #. This
line should not be processed. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Output
</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input except the
last one, produce one line of output containing the best strategy for that
deal. If the best strategy is to stay with the initial cards, print the word
&quot;Stay&quot;. If the best strategy is to exchange, print the line &quot;Exchange
XY&quot;, where XY is the two-<span class=SpellE>charcter</span> string of the
card you want to discard, in the format defined above.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>If there is more than one optimal
strategy for a given deal, print any one of them. A special judge will evaluate
your output. Don't use extra spaces or blank lines, and don't print the
surrounding quotes. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                               </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=399 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>TH JH QH KH AH<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2H TC 5D 3S 6C<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2S 5S 8D JC JH<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>#</span></b><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=405 valign=top style='width:243.0pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Stay<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Exchange TC<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Stay<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>

</span></b></div>

<p class=MsoCaption><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Problem setter: Joachim <span

</div>

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

<style>
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Make a Crystal</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'>S<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>tandard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp; </p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>A scientist is trying hard to make a very large crystal, a large
crystal of Carbon to be specific. He believes, as Diamond is a crystal of
Carbon and very precious, so his new crystal of carbon would be as precious as
Diamond in the long run. The atoms in his crystal will not hold together
naturally, so he wants to put a strong force at the center of the crystal,
which will attract all the carbon atoms and keep them together.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>


<p>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/110/p11014.jpg"  ></p>
<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>The Carbon atoms in a diamond crystal can be considered to be placed in
a cube (Shown in </span><b>Figure</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>
</span><b>2</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>). The scientist also
wants to place the carbon atoms of his crystal in an </span><b>(N x N x N)</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> cube, where </span><b>N</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> is an even number. If the center of this
cube is </span><b>(0<span class=GramE>,0,0</span>)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'> and all the sides of this cube are parallel to </span><span
class=SpellE><b>xy</b></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, </span><span
class=SpellE><b>yz</b></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> or </span><span
class=SpellE><b>xz</b></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> plane
then all the atoms will be placed in three-dimensional integer coordinates. So
if </span><b>(x, y, z)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> is the
coordinate of an atom placed in an </span><b>(N*N*N)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'> cube then </span><b>x</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, </span><b>y</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, and </span><b>z</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> are integers and </span><b>(-N/2&lt;=x, y,
z&lt;=N/2)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>. <span class=GramE>As
the strong force at the center will attract all the atoms so the atoms are
placed in such a way so that no atom is between the center and another atom.</span>
For example if there is an atom at coordinate </span><b>(2, 2, 2)</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> then no atoms should be placed in
coordinate </span><b>(1, 1, 1)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> as
then the atom at </span><b>(1, 1, 1)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>
will block the attractive force between </span><b>(2, 2, 2)</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> and the center. Similarly if there is an
atom at place </span><b>(1, 1, <span class=GramE>1</span>)</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> then there should be no atom in location </span><b>(2,
2, 2)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>. </span><b>Figure 3</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> shows such an arrangement for </span><b>(4x4x4)</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> cube: if atoms are placed in all integer
coordinates (the value of </span><b>x</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>, </span><b>y</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> and </span><b>z</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> are integers) except those marked with
black circles, no atom will be between the center and another atom. Given the
size of the cube (length of one side) in which atoms are to be placed to make
the crystal, your job is to find out the maximum number of atoms that can be
placed following the constraints mentioned above <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal'>The input file contains at most </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>30</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> lines of inputs. Each line contains an even integer </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>N</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(0&lt;N&lt;=200000),</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> which indicates the length of one side of the cube in
which the scientist plans to put his atoms. Input is terminated by a line where
the value of </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>N</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is zero.</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each line
of input except the last one produce one line of output. This line should
contain the serial of output followed by an integer, which denotes the maximum
number of atoms that can be placed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=384 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=386 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <h6>Crystal 1: 98</h6>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Crystal
  2: 26<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=3 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:windowtext'>Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor, EPS<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;color:windowtext'>Special Thanks: Derek <span class=SpellE>Kisman</span>,
EPS</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Arial'>/* It is probably one of my most
favorite problems, of all the problems that I have ever set. It is very much possible
that many papers or research works exist on the idea of this problem. But as a
problem setter I am not aware of those papers. <span class=GramE>Me</span> and <span
class=SpellE>Kisman</span> took two different approaches to solve this problem.
Unfortunately, his method was more elegant and faster. */<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>
